flex-wrap"><div><div class="mb-3">Sector: <strong>Information Technology</strong><span class="sc-cpUzJl jifSPb px-1 relative text-3xl">.</span>Industry: <strong class="hightlight">Technology Hardware, Storage &amp; Peripherals</strong></div><div><div class="sc-eSoWNj jvSMKU">Apple designs a wide variety of consumer electronic devices, including smartphones (iPhone), tablets (iPad), PCs (Mac), smartwatches (Apple Watch), and TV boxes (Apple TV), among others. The iPhone makes up the majority of Apple&#x27;s total revenue. In addition, Apple offers its customers a variety of services such as Apple Music, iCloud, Apple Care, Apple TV+, Apple Arcade, Apple Card, and Apple Pay, among others. Apple&#x27;s products run internally developed software and semiconductors, and the firm is well known for its integration of hardware, software and services. Apple&#x27;s products are distributed online as well as through company-owned stores and third-party retailers. The company generates roughly 40% of its revenue from the Americas, with the remainder earned internationally.<div class="sc-ainUS ilMVXl"></div></div><div class="sc-jNjApQ golwPT ant-divider -0400","updated":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 16:40:49 -0400","title":"Amazon Sidewalk: What Investors, Device Owners Should Know","teaser":"\u003cp\u003eOne of the largest companies in the world is launching a new service that will connect networks to different internet connections via their smart devices. The new technology has some positives mentioned by the company but also comes\u0026nbsp;with red flags.\u003c/p\u003e","body":"\u003cp\u003eOne of the largest companies in the world is launching a new service that will connect networks to different internet connections via their smart devices. The new technology has some positives mentioned by the company but also comes\u0026nbsp;with red flags.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened: \u003c/strong\u003eSidewalk, an internet sharing network from \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon.com Inc \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/amzn#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e), is an effort from the company to connect its devices and third parties.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon\u0026rsquo;s internet sharing network will connect millions of Amazon Echo and Tile devices, according to \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/22516285/amazon-sidewalk-echo-tile-ring\"\u003eRecode\u003c/a\u003e. The devices will \u0026ldquo;mesh\u0026rdquo; together using Bluetooth and radio frequencies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMost Amazon Echo devices and Ring cameras began sharing internet capabilities and connected to the Amazon Sidewalk network as of June 8. Some newer tracking devices will be turned on beginning June 14.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe devices will connect to other Sidewalk-enabled devices within range, like other houses in your neighborhood. This practice will allow devices to stay connected to the internet even if out of range of a Wi-Fi network or the internet goes down.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon is actively soliciting developers to add Sidewalk capabilities to other devices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/21/05/21322066/eu-privacy-watchdog-initiates-probe-against-amazon-microsofts-cloud-service-to-eu-institutions-reute\"\u003eEU Privacy Watchdog Initiates Probe Against Amazon\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmazon Sidewalk Positives, Negatives: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon mentions several benefits for its new Sidewalk network. Having the service can allow a Ring security camera to continue to send alerts if the internet goes down. Sidewalk could also help find a lost pet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCareband, a wearable locator for people with dementia, is working to see if Amazon Sidewalk could help the company.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe biggest negatives are data and privacy. The Amazon Sidewalk network will see data passing through your neighbor\u0026rsquo;s devices and vice versa.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOwners of Amazon Sidewalk-connected devices will also share a small amount of internet bandwidth (500mb monthly max).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnother potential red flag is Amazon\u0026rsquo;s decision to automatically opt in users into the Sidewalk service rather than allowing users the ability to decide if they want to be a part of the free service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;If this service is not providing you additional functionality you need, it certainly seems like this should be off,\u0026rdquo; Northeastern University associate professor David Choffnes told Recode.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon told Recode that the decision to make the service opt out was done to make it easier for customers to take advantage of the benefits of Amazon Sidewalk.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;If you can\u0026rsquo;t provide a compelling reason for everybody to opt in, that\u0026rsquo;s a red flag,\u0026rdquo; Choffnes said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/aapl#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) has a similar Find My Network option that uses all Apple devices that have the service enabled. The service will also help boost the profile for Apple AirTags.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOpting Out:\u003c/strong\u003e Amazon product owners who want to opt out of the Amazon Sidewalk service have several options.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon Echo device owners can open the Alexa app, go to settings, account setting, Amazon Sidewalk and choose disabled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eRing owners can go to control center, Amazon Sidewalk, select disabled and confirm.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto courtesy of Amazon.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/21/06/21480549/amazon-sidewalk-what-investors-device-owners-should-know","image":"https://cdn.benzinga.com/files/imagecache/1024x768xUP/images/story/2012/echo_dot_charcoal_side_1.png","image_thumb":"https://cdn.benzinga.com/files/imagecache/250x187xUP/images/story/2012/echo_dot_charcoal_side_1.png","image_large":"https://cdn.benzinga.com/files/imagecache/2048x1536xUP/images/story/2012/echo_dot_charcoal_side_1.png","channels":[{"tid":57,"name":"News","description":""},{"tid":6,"name":"Tech","description":""},{"tid":5,"name":"Media","description":""}],"stocks":[{"tid":10394,"name":"AAPL","description":"Apple"},{"tid":10555,"name":"AMZN","description":"Amazon"}],"tags":[{"tid":796268,"name":"AirTags","description":""},{"tid":144878,"name":"Amazon and a revamped iMessage feature set,\u0026rdquo; Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives said in a note.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe analyst, who has an Outperform rating and a price target of $185 for the (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/fb#NASDAQ\"\u003eFB\u003c/a\u003e) around how users can block data tracking.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThere was other news, virtual event, with some key items being announced.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFamed Apple analyst and managing partner at Loup Ventures\u0026nbsp;Gene Munster offered his take on Apple\u0026#39;s software-focused event.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFive Features That Stood Out: \u003c/strong\u003e Out of the slew of announcements, Munster sees the following as key features:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e1. Mail Privacy Protection that will lead to spam reduction\u003cbr /\u003e\n2. FaceTime scheduling, and music, video and document sharing features\u003cbr /\u003e\n3. Apple Wallet driver\u0026#39;s license support\u003cbr /\u003e\n4. Siri voice control expansion to Apple TV and third-party hardware\u003cbr /\u003e\n5. watchOS 8\u0026nbsp;biomarker update\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCalm Before The Storm: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple\u0026#39;s announcements Monday collectively add up to a tighter ecosystem, improving the ease of use of products, Munster said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eApple\u0026#39;s exciting hardware announcements, the analyst said, typically arrive in September and October.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;From a high level, this year, and maybe even next year\u0026#39;s WWDC event, will amount to a calm before an Apple innovation storm,\u0026quot; the analyst wrote in the note.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eApple\u0026#39;s intense ongoing development related to new product categories around augmented reality wearables and transportation was evident from the announcements, Munster said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link: \u003ca href=\" https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/20/12/18910330/10-things-apple-investors-may-wish-for-in-2021\"\u003e 10 Things Apple Investors May Wish For In 2021 \u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple Shows Intent On Appstore Commission: \u003c/strong\u003e Although Apple did not directly discuss the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"http://www.benzinga.com/news/21/05/20929447/apple-in-epic-antitrust-trial-says-it-doesnt-want-to-be-like-android\"\u003eongoing issue\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;with Epic Games, it made a subtle overture to remind developers what it is doing to earn its 15%-30% commission, Munster said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis included reporting for the first time the App Store\u0026#39;s reach, which is currently 600m unique users per week, he added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFor developers, Apple announced In-App Events, a feature allowing\u0026nbsp;developers to promote live events to engage users, and Xcode Cloud, a cloud-based solution to make it easier to build, test and deploy apps across Apple devices, Munster noted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOther Announcements: \u003c/strong\u003e With the iOS 15, FaceTime was overhauled with better sharing and scheduling features, Munster said. On a feature-by-feature basis, FaceTime now looks superior to \u003cstrong\u003eZoom Video Communications\u0026nbsp;Inc\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/zm#NASDAQ\"\u003eZM\u003c/a\u003e), although from a branding perspective the latter still owns the lucrative business market, the analyst noted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOn privacy, the analyst delved into\u0026nbsp;Mail Privacy Protection, which\u0026nbsp;will hide a user\u0026#39;s IP address, location and whether they opened an email or not, and iCloud+, which will use a private relay to ensure traffic leaving your device is encrypted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe MacOS Monterey comes with a \u0026quot;Universal Control\u0026quot; feature that will let\u0026nbsp;users control a Mac and iPad with the same mouse, the analyst noted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Essentially, an iPad can be used as a Mac\u0026#39;s second monitor,\u0026quot; he added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAnticipated Announcements That Did Not Quite Materialize: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple did not reveal new added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Our best guess is that an MR device will be previewed at next year\u0026#39;s WWDC,\u0026quot; Munster And show new traders and investors just how easy it can be to beat this crazy market against all odds!\u0026nbsp;\u003c\\/p\u003e\\r\\n\u003cp style=\\\"padding-left: 60px;\\\"\u003e\u003ca href=\\\"https:\\/\\/www.benzinga.com\\/premium\\/ideas\\/breakout-monthly\\/?utm_medium=bottom2\u0026amp;amp;amp;utm_source=bottom2\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/dabuttonfactory.com\\/button.png?t=Click+Here+To+Discover+How\u0026amp;f=Open+Sans-Bold\u0026amp;ts=18\u0026amp;tc=fff\u0026amp;hp=45\u0026amp;vp=20\u0026amp;c=11\u0026amp;bgt=unicolored\u0026amp;bgc=f00\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"335\\\" height=\\\"58\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\u003c\\/p\u003e\";\n  if($('.bz-campaign-text-bottom')) {\n    // Jquery prevents scripts from being written\n    if($('.bz-campaign-text-bottom').length \u003e 0) {\n      $('.bz-campaign-text-bottom')[0].innerHTML = bzCampaignJS_bottom;\n    }\n\n    // Rewrite and Execute any JS after loading.\n    $('.bz-campaign-text-bottom script').each(function() {\n      var script = document.createElement('script');\n      var text = $(this).text();\n      text = text.replace(/[\\r\\n]/g, \" \");\n      script[(script.innerText===undefined?\"textContent\":\"innerText\")] = text;\n      //console.log(text);\n      //console.log(script);\n      document.documentElement.appendChild(script);\n    });\n  }"},{"id":21474477,"author":"JJ Kinahan","created":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 10:09:56 -0400","updated":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 10:09:58 -0400","title":"Pharma, Biotech Stocks Start Week With A Bang After Biogen's Alzheimer's  Approval","teaser":"\u003cp\u003eIf you\u0026rsquo;re reading this, then apparently you weren\u0026rsquo;t affected by a global internet outage that hit many news websites. The outage appeared to hurt stock futures overnight, but things recovered to flat in the hours right before the open.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e","body":"\u003cp\u003eIf you\u0026rsquo;re reading this, then apparently you weren\u0026rsquo;t affected by a global internet outage that hit many news websites. The outage appeared to hurt stock futures overnight, but things recovered to flat in the hours right before the open.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFlat might be the word of the day, and maybe the week, at least so far. We\u0026rsquo;re flirting with record highs but not quite reaching them. Will today be the day? Maybe, but it would help to have a few catalysts. There aren\u0026rsquo;t a lot out there, by any stretch of the imagination.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt\u0026rsquo;s one of those times when investors have to be super careful because when there\u0026rsquo;s nothing to trade on, stories that normally wouldn\u0026rsquo;t get a lot of play can sometimes start to seem really important. The market might move quickly up or down on stuff that usually would get overlooked, especially any geopolitical news or comments from the Fed. So stay on the lookout.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe week is back-weighted a bit, mainly because of Thursday\u0026rsquo;s consumer price index report and Friday\u0026rsquo;s Michigan sentiment data. The CPI report (more below) is the last major inflation-related data the Fed will see before its meeting next week.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eToday\u0026rsquo;s data scene is dominated by the monthly Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) for April, due at 10 a.m. ET. The previous report showed more than 8.1 million job openings, which was historically high. Some economists think government assistance might be preventing people from getting back to work, but virus fears and lack of childcare could also play into this.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eClose But No Cigar Again\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt\u0026rsquo;s only been a month since the\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;S\u0026amp;P 500 Index\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(SPX) set its latest all-time high at around 4238, but getting back to that point feels like climbing Everest.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOn Monday, for the second straight session, the SPX crept within points of that peak only to pull back and finish lower. The\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Dow Jones Industrial Average\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e($DJI) is also flirting with and being repelled from all-time highs. Tech stocks and small-caps had the best start to the week, lifting the\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eNasdaq 100\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NDX) and the\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eRussell 2000 Index\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(RUT) on Monday.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe RUT drew support from Healthcare, which owns the biggest weighting in the index. The entire Health sector powered higher Monday after the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eBiogen\u0026rsquo;\u003c/strong\u003es (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/biib#NASDAQ\"\u003eBIIB\u003c/a\u003e) Alzheimer\u0026rsquo;s treatment (much more below). BIIB shares jumped a massive 38% on Monday. Other companies working on treatments for the disease, notably\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eEli Lilly Co\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/lly#NYSE\"\u003eLLY\u003c/a\u003e), appeared to benefit from the approval too. LLY gained 10%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMeanwhile, the bond market barely moved Monday, at least for the closely followed 10-year yield. It\u0026rsquo;s stuck below 1.55% again this morning\u0026mdash;near where some analysts see technical support at 1.52%\u0026mdash;even as investors await a couple of large government bond auctions scheduled this week. If demand at these auctions flags, maybe that could push yields back up. For the moment, however, it feels like investors are a bit more relaxed about yields after last week\u0026rsquo;s mellow jobs report.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eMay CPI Data Seen Rising Less Than Previous Month\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf there\u0026rsquo;s anything that could change the mellow mood around rates, it\u0026rsquo;s Thursday\u0026rsquo;s May consumer price index data (CPI). Analysts expect a headline rise of 0.4% month over month, according to research firm Briefing.com. Core CPI, which strips out energy and food, is also expected to rise 0.4%. These would normally be seen as pretty high estimates, though not compared with April figures of 0.8% and 0.9%, which were monsters on a historic basis.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFrom a single-stock perspective, there weren\u0026rsquo;t a lot of big stories yesterday outside of BIIB, LLY, and\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eApple\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/aapl#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e), whose shares rebounded late after being in the red most of the day. This went against tradition because AAPL shares historically tend to fall on the first day of the company\u0026rsquo;s annual Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC).\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe rebound could have partly been technical because AAPL keeps sagging toward its 200-day moving average (now at $124.36) and then popping back up. This pattern has been going on for nearly a month, and some analysts think it could be a sign of underlying strength. On the other hand, AAPL hasn\u0026rsquo;t been able to get much traction on any of its rebounds from that technical level. The Tech sector skidded just a bit on Monday after a strong finish last week. This came as the semiconductor chip sector lost a bit of momentum.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eRecent\u0026nbsp;volatility\u0026nbsp;readings don\u0026rsquo;t show much sign of turbulence anytime soon. The\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eCboe Volatility Index\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(VIX) finished at seven-week lows last week and is now below 16.5. The historic average is close to 20. The VIX has been trading in five-point ranges, and it seems to be settling into the 15-20 range now after hanging out between 20-25 for a while earlier this year.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThere\u0026rsquo;s no lack of volatility in the so-called \u0026ldquo;meme\u0026rdquo; arena, however. Both\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eGameStop\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/gme#NYSE\"\u003eGME\u003c/a\u003e) and\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eAMC Entertainment\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/amc#NYSE\"\u003eAMC\u003c/a\u003e) kept up their wild ways to start the new week, each of them rising sharply. GME reports after the close tomorrow, so that could be an event for a lot of people.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eGains in the memes yesterday weren\u0026rsquo;t as massive as some of the gains (and losses) seen last week, though. By the way, if you are trying to stay away from these stocks, be sure to check any mutual funds you own, because both AMC and GME have gained a lot of market weight this year. Some of the small-cap funds, in particular, might have more exposure to these two.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eSome Retail Investors Try To Ease Risk\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Investor Movement Index\u0026reg; (IMXSM) increased 0.18 to 8.32 in May, up from its April score of 8.14. The IMX is TD\u0026nbsp;Ameritrade\u0026rsquo;s proprietary, behavior-based index, aggregating Main Street investor positions and activity to measure what investors actually were doing and how they were positioned in the markets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eClients tracked by IMX seemed to be trying to take some risk off the table in May, for instance favoring fixed income over equities. It\u0026rsquo;s the first time since October of last year that clients have been net sellers of equities, while mostly maintaining their level of overall exposure to the markets in an environment in which the Indices were mostly unchanged.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis is often caused by the equity buys being in higher Beta stocks. Looking forward it seems economic optimism may be on the rise\u0026mdash;the economy is slowly but surely gaining strength and the market seems to have shaken off some of the recent inflation worries for now.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBig net-buys among the clients trackers in May included\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eAdvanced Micro Devices\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/amd#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMD\u003c/a\u003e),\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eApple\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/aapl#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e), and\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eAirBnB\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/abnb#NASDAQ\"\u003eABNB\u003c/a\u003e), the IMX found. Big net-sells included\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eModerna\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/mrna#NASDAQ\"\u003eMRNA\u003c/a\u003e),\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eNokia\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/nok#NYSE\"\u003eNOK\u003c/a\u003e), and\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003ePfizer\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/pfe#NYSE\"\u003ePFE\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://tickertapecdn.tdameritrade.com/assets/images/pages/lg/2021-06-08-chart.png\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"philadelphia semiconductor index\" src=\"https://tickertapecdn.tdameritrade.com/assets/images/pages/md/2021-06-08-chart.png\" style=\"height:331px; width:640px\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eCHART OF THE DAY:\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;BIOTECH REBOUNDS.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eThe\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Nasdaq Biotech Index\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NBI\u0026mdash;candlestick) has lagged the\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eNasdaq 100\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NDX\u0026mdash;purple line) and the broader market much of the year, but appeared to get a nice boost Monday after the FDA approved\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eBiogen\u0026rsquo;s\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(BIIB) Alzheimer\u0026rsquo;s disease drug. Data Source: Nasdaq.\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eChart source: The\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.tdameritrade.com/tools-and-platforms/thinkorswim.page\"\u003ethinkorswim\u0026reg; platform\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003eFor illustrative purposes only. Past performance does not guarantee future results.\u003c/em\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTracking Prices As CPI Looms:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;With Friday\u0026rsquo;s jobs report over and done, the biggest data point ahead of next week\u0026rsquo;s Fed meeting is Thursday\u0026rsquo;s consumer price index (CPI) for May. Back in April, CPI jumped 0.8% from the month before, and core CPI (which strips out energy and food prices) rose 0.9%, the highest month-over-month rise since April 1982.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOne question is whether recent wage growth could translate into higher prices. There\u0026rsquo;s no definitive answer, but the Chicago Tribune reported last week that some restaurant workers aren\u0026rsquo;t planning to come back to work until their benefits run out, and that restaurants in the city are having trouble filling positions. This kind of thing is something that could play into ideas that employers might have to raise wages to lure people back to jobs, which conceivably could fire up inflation. \u0026ldquo;The data for the last two months suggests that the rising demand for the labor associated with the recovery from the pandemic may have put upward pressure on wages,\u0026rdquo; the Labor Department said in the jobs report press release.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOverall, core inflation rose 3% year-over-year in April compared with 1.6% in March, the kind of move that might seem scary if you didn\u0026rsquo;t keep it in context. Remember that the previous April was the heart of the pandemic shutdown, and May was also pretty slow last year. This means comparisons are slightly out of whack and the year-over-year number might get a little less attention from here on, at least while the economy laps those weird early days of Covid a year ago.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBig FDA Approval May Have Wider Ripples:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Yesterday\u0026rsquo;s U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approval of\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Biogen\u0026rsquo;s\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/biib#NASDAQ\"\u003eBIIB\u003c/a\u003e) Aducanumab (brand name Aduhelm) wasn\u0026rsquo;t just the first time the FDA has approved a new drug for Alzheimer\u0026rsquo;s disease since 2003. It also might imply some ripples for the entire U.S. pharmaceutical industry.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTwo of the FDA\u0026rsquo;s key thresholds for drug approval are safety and efficacy. Meaning data from clinical trials must show not just that a drug is safe to use, but also that it really works. That\u0026rsquo;s a stricter standard than the European Medicines Agency (EMA), which gives the green light \u0026ldquo;if the benefits of the medicine are greater than its risks,\u0026rdquo; as the EMA says on its internet site. Going into the Aduhelm decision, there was mixed data on the drug\u0026rsquo;s efficacy, with two studies in direct conflict. An FDA panel of outside experts actually advised the FDA to reject the drug based on questions over efficacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn its approval, the FDA said Aduhelm \u0026ldquo;consistently and very convincingly reduced the level of amyloid plaques in the brain\u0026rdquo; in both studies. A reduction in those plaques is \u0026ldquo;reasonably likely to predict important benefits to patients,\u0026rdquo; the agency added. Let\u0026rsquo;s play that tape again: \u0026ldquo;Reasonably likely to predict\u0026rdquo; isn\u0026rsquo;t the same as \u0026ldquo;effective,\u0026rdquo; so maybe the FDA is taking a slightly different approach here\u0026mdash;with the caveat that the FDA will require BIIB to conduct post-approval studies to show clinical benefit and could pull approval if those fail. The other change from normal protocol was the FDA overruling its advisory committee, which is rare. All this could get people thinking about what it means for future drug approvals.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBiotech Gets A Booster\u003c/strong\u003e: The\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eNasdaq Biotech Index\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NBI) enjoyed a nice jolt from yesterday\u0026rsquo;s BIIB drug approval, quickly jumping to 3.6% gains. Strength in BIIB, one of the sector\u0026rsquo;s largest stocks, likely played a role. But you can\u0026rsquo;t rule out some strength coming from ideas that the FDA might be more likely to approve future drugs with a slightly different approach that seems at first glance a bit more favorable for drug companies. After all, as noted above, the BIIB approval came despite conflicting trial results and an FDA panel rejection. We\u0026rsquo;ll share more thoughts tomorrow on how this might affect the biotech sector over the long-term.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTD Ameritrade\u0026reg; commentary for educational purposes only. Member SIPC.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eImage Sourced from U.S.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","body":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ePresident Joe Biden\u0026rsquo;s $2.3 trillion infrastructure proposal is packed with an ambitious green agenda for the U.S.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eIncluded in the plan is $620 billion in transportation spending with \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2021/03/31/fact-sheet-the-american-jobs-plan/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e$174 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e invested in the electric vehicle (EV) market. The plan will enable automakers to spur domestic supply chains from raw materials to parts, retool factories and give consumers point-of-sale rebates and tax incentives to buy affordable American-made EVs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMoreover, it will establish grant and incentive programs for state and local governments and the private sector to build a national network of 500,000 EV chargers by 2030.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eTraditional automakers including Ford (NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/f#NYSE\"\u003eF\u003c/a\u003e), General Motors (NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/gm#NYSE\"\u003eGM\u003c/a\u003e) and Nikola (NASDAQ: NKL\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eA) \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eare competing with tech companies such as Amazon (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/amzn#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e), Google\u0026rsquo;s parent Alphabet (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/googl#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOGL\u003c/a\u003e), Intel Corporation (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/intc#NASDAQ\"\u003eINTC\u003c/a\u003e) and Nvidia Corporation (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/nvda#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e) to get a piece of the EV pie.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRecently, reports about Apple (NASDAQ: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/aapl#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) joining the EV bandwagon have surfaced. According to The Korea Times, Apple is close to signing an agreement\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e with LG Magna e-Powertrain (KRX: 066570). \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eIf the agreement with LG Magna is reached, the two parties will then jointly establish the precise details for the production of the Apple car, and a prototype might be teased in early 2024.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOne company that stands to benefit from this spectacularly is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWorksport (OTC: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/wksp#OTC\"\u003eWKSP\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eDisruptive Innovation\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e\u003ciframe src=\"//player.vimeo.com/video/490551300?title=0\u0026amp;amp;byline=0\" width=\"425\" height=\"350\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eFounded in 2011, Worksport is a globally recognized designer and producer of tonneau or truck bed covers. The Canadian-based company is a disruptive innovator with its mobile solar technology \u0026mdash;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e t\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ehe TerraVis\u0026trade;.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe technology provides solar power to over 50 million light trucks on the roads today and is a key source of clean energy to recharge upcoming EV trucks. The TerraVis\u0026trade; can provide up to 30% or more of the power needed for the average daily commute.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe TerraVis\u0026trade; system is a first-of-its-kind mobile solar power generation system. It can generate up to 1kWh of mobile power off-grid. The TerraVis\u0026trade; Cor battery system takes power from the cover and stores it in modular battery packs \u0026mdash; storing 1.5 kWh of energy in up to 4 batteries that can be transported in the truck bed using the mounting system.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe TerraVis Cor can also act as a standalone consumer product \u0026mdash; making it available for purchase even if you\u0026rsquo;re not a truck owner. The system will allow the same level of freedom from a power grid, being chargeable via any wall outlet, solar panel or 12V power source.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eEarly Mover Advantage\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWorksport will leverage the TerraVis\u0026trade; system and its position as a Tier 1 original equipment manufacturer (OEM) to secure future partnerships and distribution of its conventional truck bed tonneau covers.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe company has already forged OEM supply partnerships with 2 EV truck nameplates \u0026mdash; one of which is in partnership w\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eith Nissan (OTCMKTS: NSANY)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eApart from the tonneau cover market, Worksport finds itself in the pickup specialty equipment market \u0026mdash; $12 billion as a whole \u0026mdash; with the EV market (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.alliedmarketresearch.com/electric-vehicle-market#:~:text=Request%20Now%20!,registering%20a%20CAGR%20of%2022.6%25.\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e$162 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e) and the battery storage system market (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketsandmarkets.com/Market-Reports/battery-energy-storage-system-market-112809494.html?gclid=Cj0KCQjwh_eFBhDZARIsALHjIKfinmWGLN_A2x6v5-xVkPiQOm2Zwb_roAEWKY3AfU7fdadP44Q0DjIaAj51EALw_wcB\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e$2.9 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWorksport is now in an enviable position as it stands to support a plethora of EV giants and traditional automotive makers that are committing to electrification.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRecent Developments\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOn June 1, 2021, Worksport forged a working relationship with Ontario Tech University (OTU) that will start as a 2-year contract. With this partnership, the company will get access to the world-class ACE Testing facility, collaborating with the research team that is supervised by Professor Sheldon Williamson, Ph.D.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWorksport plans to finish prototy\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eping the TerraVis solar truck bed cover system by\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e the end of Q3 2021. OTU and Worksport will complete validation and fine-tuning for TerraVis pre-launch in Q4 2021, and accelerate toward full manufacturing in 2022.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eTerraVis Cor\u0026trade; has entered the production prototype phase with the first pre-production prototype expected to be ready by early Q3 2021. The prototype system(s) will be fully operational and is expected to mirror the commercial model available at the turn of 2022.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOn May 27, 2021, Worksport decided to take advantage of its recent opportunities in raising capital to onboard several new hires: 2 full-time industrial engineers, 1 industrial designer with specialties in 3D modeling and interactive preparation, and 2 advisory engineers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWorksport currently has $10 million in cash and cash equivalents with no long-term debt.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eTo learn more about Worksport, you can visit its website \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://worksport.com/us/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ehere\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWorksport is a partner of Benzinga. href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/21/06/21372617/apples-worldwide-developers-conference-is-almost-here-what-you-need-to-know\"\u003eWorldwide Developers Conference\u003c/a\u003e Monday\u0026nbsp;with\u0026nbsp;a keynote address.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCEO Tim Cook got\u0026nbsp;the ball rolling by welcoming the participants of the virtual conference and providing them with information about\u0026nbsp;what to expect.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNew iOS: \u003c/strong\u003e Craig Federighi, senior vice president of software engineering,\u0026nbsp;announced iOS 15, the next iteration of its OS powering the iPhone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWith the new OS, FaceTime, the company\u0026#39;s video calling app, will have spatial audio\u0026nbsp;allowing the conversation to flow as easily as they do face-to-face. The new OS will provide two powerful options for the microphone:\u0026nbsp;voice isolation that blocks out ambient voices\u0026nbsp;and wide-spectrum, which is when\u0026nbsp;the mic picks up all sounds.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe new OS also allows generating FaceTime links for scheduling calls and share them anywhere. Grid view and portrait mode were also introduced.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eApple announced SharePlay for shared listening and watching experiences, while on a FaceTime call. FaceTime will now support non-Apple devices like Android smartphones.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eiMessage users will have access to new options to collage and stack photos for sharing. The company also announced Focus, which\u0026nbsp;lets users focus while doing other work. Notifications will now have a Notification Summary.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe new OS gives Wallet the ability to be used as a digital identification at airports across the U.S. Upon scanning a driver\u0026#39;s license or state ID, it can be used as a digital ID.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMacOS Monterey: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple also previewed macOS Monterey, the latest version of its desktop operating system.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;We think our customers are going to love browsing the web with Safari\u0026#39;s new tab design, enjoying shared experiences with SharePlay in FaceTime, and using their Mac and other Apple devices together in new ways with Universal Control and AirPlay to Mac,\u0026quot; Federighi said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/20/12/18910330/10-things-apple-investors-may-wish-for-in-2021\"\u003e10 Things Apple Investors May Wish For In 2021\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eiPadOS 15: \u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/trading-ideas/long-ideas/21/06/21448674/dan-ives-says-apple-is-headed-to-3-trillion-market-cap\"\u003eApple\u003c/a\u003e unveiled iPadOS 15\u0026nbsp;with new features that help users be more productive and taking the versatility of iPad even further.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eA new multitasking menu appears at the top of apps, letting users go into Split View or Slide Over with just a tap. Users can now place widgets among apps on Home Screen pages, providing more information at a glance and offering a more personalized experience.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe App Library also comes to the iPad. With the new OS, Notes goes systemwide with Quick Note.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWatch OS 8: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple announced Watch OS 8, and updates to the Wallet and Home apps provided by the new OS makes Apple Watch an increasingly useful tool for convenient access.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;With WatchOS 8, Wallet brings even more powerful contact-free ways for users to access the places and things they care about seamlessly, safely, and securely,\u0026quot; the company said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eUltrawideband support comes for digital car keys on Apple Watch Series 6. Apple Watch wearers can securely unlock their car from a distance and start it from the driver\u0026#39;s seat.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNew Privacy Features: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple unveiled new privacy protections in iOS 15, iPadOS 15, macOS Monterey, and watchOS 8, which help users better control and manage access to their data.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThese features help protect data from third parties, check up on app privacy, process audio of users\u0026#39; requests on Siri and enhance internet privacy with iCloud+.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHealthcare Data Sharing: \u003c/strong\u003eApple announced advanced consumer health and wellness insights for users, as well as new tools for supporting loved ones. The OS 15 gives users the ability to securely share their data with important people in their life and receive insights into the health trends. Additionally, new tools can be used to identify, measure\u0026nbsp;and understand changes in a person\u0026#39;s health data.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDeveloper Tools \u0026amp; Technologies: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple unveiled Xcode Cloud that brings together the multiple tasks and tools required to build, test\u0026nbsp;and deliver apps using powerful cloud services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWith In-App Events and Custom Product Pages, the App Store now provides ways for developers to promote their apps and connect with users. Swift will offer concurrency support built into the language\u0026nbsp;and augmented reality technologies will help build immersive content in apps or on the web.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eApple Tools","teaser":"Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) kicked off its five-day annual Worldwide Developers Conference Monday with a keynote address.","body":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) kicked off its five-day annual \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/21/06/21372617/apples-worldwide-developers-conference-is-almost-here-what-you-need-to-know\"\u003eWorldwide Developers Conference\u003c/a\u003e Monday\u0026nbsp;with\u0026nbsp;a keynote address.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eCEO Tim Cook got\u0026nbsp;the ball rolling by welcoming the participants of the virtual conference and providing them with information about\u0026nbsp;what to expect.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNew iOS: \u003c/strong\u003e Craig Federighi, senior vice president of software engineering,\u0026nbsp;announced iOS 15, the next iteration of its OS powering the iPhone.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWith the new OS, FaceTime, the company\u0026#39;s video calling app, will have spatial audio\u0026nbsp;allowing the conversation to flow as easily as they do face-to-face. The new OS will provide two powerful options for the microphone:\u0026nbsp;voice isolation that blocks out ambient voices\u0026nbsp;and wide-spectrum, which is when\u0026nbsp;the mic picks up all sounds.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe new OS also allows generating FaceTime links for scheduling calls and share them anywhere. Grid view and portrait mode were also introduced.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eApple announced SharePlay for shared listening and watching experiences, while on a FaceTime call. FaceTime will now support non-Apple devices like Android smartphones.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eiMessage users will have access to new options to collage and stack photos for sharing. The company also announced Focus, which\u0026nbsp;lets users focus while doing other work. Notifications will now have a Notification Summary.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe new OS gives Wallet the ability to be used as a digital identification at airports across the U.S. Upon scanning a driver\u0026#39;s license or state ID, it can be used as a digital ID.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMacOS Monterey: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple also previewed macOS Monterey, the latest version of its desktop operating system.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;We think our customers are going to love browsing the web with Safari\u0026#39;s new tab design, enjoying shared experiences with SharePlay in FaceTime, and using their Mac and other Apple devices together in new ways with Universal Control and AirPlay to Mac,\u0026quot; Federighi said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/20/12/18910330/10-things-apple-investors-may-wish-for-in-2021\"\u003e10 Things Apple Investors May Wish For In 2021\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eiPadOS 15: \u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/trading-ideas/long-ideas/21/06/21448674/dan-ives-says-apple-is-headed-to-3-trillion-market-cap\"\u003eApple\u003c/a\u003e unveiled iPadOS 15\u0026nbsp;with new features that help users be more productive and taking the versatility of iPad even further.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eA new multitasking menu appears at the top of apps, letting users go into Split View or Slide Over with just a tap. Users can now place widgets among apps on Home Screen pages, providing more information at a glance and offering a more personalized experience.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe App Library also comes to the iPad. With the new OS, Notes goes systemwide with Quick Note.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWatch OS 8: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple announced Watch OS 8, and updates to the Wallet and Home apps provided by the new OS makes Apple Watch an increasingly useful tool for convenient access.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;With WatchOS 8, Wallet brings even more powerful contact-free ways for users to access the places and things they care about seamlessly, safely, and securely,\u0026quot; the company said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eUltrawideband support comes for digital car keys on Apple Watch Series 6. Apple Watch wearers can securely unlock their car from a distance and start it from the driver\u0026#39;s seat.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNew Privacy Features: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple unveiled new privacy protections in iOS 15, iPadOS 15, macOS Monterey, and watchOS 8, which help users better control and manage access to their data.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThese features help protect data from third parties, check up on app privacy, process audio of users\u0026#39; requests on Siri and enhance internet privacy with iCloud+.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHealthcare Data Sharing: \u003c/strong\u003eApple announced advanced consumer health and wellness insights for users, as well as new tools for supporting loved ones. The OS 15 gives users the ability to securely share their data with important people in their life and receive insights into the health trends. Additionally, new tools can be used to identify, measure\u0026nbsp;and understand changes in a person\u0026#39;s health data.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDeveloper Tools \u0026amp; Technologies: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple unveiled Xcode Cloud that brings together the multiple tasks and tools required to build, test\u0026nbsp;and deliver apps using powerful cloud services.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWith In-App Events and Custom Product Pages, the App Store now provides ways for developers to promote their apps and connect with users. Swift will offer concurrency support built into the language\u0026nbsp;and augmented reality technologies will help build immersive content in apps or on the web.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eApple closed Monday little changed at $125.90, and was seen adding 0.040% after-hours\u0026nbsp;at publication.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/21/06/21460278/what-to-know-from-apples-wwdc-keynote-ios-15-improved-privacy-features-developer-tools","image":[{"size":"thumb","url":"https://cdn.benzinga.com/files/imagecache/250x187xUP/images/story/2012/apple_iphone12pro-ios15-3up_060721_big.jpg.large_.jpg"},{"size":"small","url":"https://cdn.benzinga.com/files/imagecache/1024x768xUP/images/story/2012/apple_iphone12pro-ios15-3up_060721_big.jpg.large_.jpg"},{"size":"large","url":"https://cdn.benzinga.com/files/imagecache/2048x1536xUP/images/story/2012/apple_iphone12pro-ios15-3up_060721_big.jpg.large_.jpg"}],"channels":[{"name":"News"},{"name":"Events"},{"name":"Tech"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[{"name":"Craig Federighi"},{"name":"Tim Cook"},{"name":"Worldwide Developer Conference"},{"name":"WWDC"},{"name":"WWDC21"}]},"21465446":{"id":21465446,"author":"Shanthi Rexaline","created":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 05:44:02 -0400","updated":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 05:58:33 -0400","title":"Apple in Talks with Tesla Supplier CATL for Battery Supply Deal: Report","teaser":"After a period of \u0026#39;no news\u0026#39; Apple\u0026#39;s software-focused event.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFive Features That Stood Out: \u003c/strong\u003e Out of the slew of announcements, Munster sees the Control\u0026quot; feature that will let\u0026nbsp;users control a Mac and iPad with the same mouse, the analyst noted.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Essentially, an iPad can be used as a Mac\u0026#39;s second monitor,\u0026quot; he added.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAnticipated Announcements That Did Not Quite Materialize: \u003c/strong\u003e Apple did not
