08 Jun 2021 12:49:57 -0400","updated":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 12:53:04 -0400","title":"Alibaba Group Holding: Time to Jump Back In?","teaser":"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\n\nI’ve made good money on Alibaba Group Holding (NASDAQ:BABA) stock.\nSource: Jirapong Manustrong / Shutterstock.com\nThese aren’t paper gains.","body":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eI\u0026rsquo;ve made good money on \u003cstrong\u003eAlibaba Group Holding\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/baba-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBABA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) stock.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/baba1600e-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"Alibaba (BABA) logo displayed on phone screen in person's hands\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Jirapong Manustrong / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThese aren\u0026rsquo;t paper gains. They\u0026rsquo;re cash in my pocket since I recently sold out a position for a 21% profit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSince I last sold, at $236 per share, BABA stock dropped to $205 but then recovered. Alibaba stock trades today at $215. At that price, you\u0026rsquo;re paying about 5.3x last year\u0026rsquo;s revenue of $112 billion (the yuan trades at 6.4 to the dollar). You\u0026rsquo;re also paying less than 26x earnings, in a world where big cloud companies trade much higher.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnyway, Al Gore says \u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/al-gore-bought-alibaba-stock-sold-airbnb-schwab-texas-instruments-51622150849\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eit\u0026rsquo;s time to buy\u003c/a\u003e. Jim Cramer says \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/25/cramers-lightning-round-alibaba-and-virtu-financial-are-buys-.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eit\u0026rsquo;s time to buy\u003c/a\u003e. Even Charlie Munger of \u003cstrong\u003eBerkshire Hathaway\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/brk.a-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBRK.A\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, NYSE:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/brk.b-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBRK.B\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) says \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/investors-charlie-munger-alibaba-164620022.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eit\u0026rsquo;s time to buy.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhat should you and I think?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eThe Dragon in the Room\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe dragon in the room when you\u0026rsquo;re looking at Alibaba is China\u0026rsquo;s government.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/06/the-7-best-micro-cap-stocks-you-can-buy-now/\"\u003eThe 7 Best Micro-Cap Stocks You Can Buy Now\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eMany conservatives love calling China \u0026ldquo;communist.\u0026rdquo; It\u0026rsquo;s more accurate to say China is a mandarin-driven autocracy, with President Xi Jinping in the role of both emperor and head mandarin.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eXi is what President Donald Trump dreamed of being. Xi says jump and even Alibaba co-founder Jack Ma asks how high. \u003ca href=\"https://time.com/6048539/china-tech-giants-regulations/\"\u003eAmericans write breathlessly\u003c/a\u003e about Ma \u0026ldquo;being cut down to size.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBut there\u0026rsquo;s little China\u0026rsquo;s government is demanding that America\u0026rsquo;s own governing class doesn\u0026rsquo;t want from \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/goog-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOG\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/googl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOGL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eFacebook\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/fb-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFB\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eTwitter\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/twtr-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTWTR\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) or \u003cstrong\u003eSoFi\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/sofi-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSOFI\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e). They want transparency. \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinas-tech-clampdown-is-spreading-like-wildfire-11622971802\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eThey want fair treatment of workers and data.\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;There\u0026rsquo;s a special urgency because China\u0026rsquo;s online economy is a bigger portion of the whole than even ours. Tech regulation is economic regulation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe question is how much will this cost China\u0026rsquo;s cloud stocks such as Alibaba, \u003cstrong\u003eTencent Holding\u003c/strong\u003e (OTCMKTS:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/tcehy-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTCEHY\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eJD.com\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/jd-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJD\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) and \u003cstrong\u003eBaidu\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/bidu-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBIDU\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eThe Alibaba Growth Story\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite the \u0026ldquo;crackdown,\u0026rdquo; Alibaba is growing faster than ever. Revenue grew 40% in fiscal 2021 compared with 2020. Despite its woes Alibaba brought about 20% of that to the net income line. Unlike \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amzn-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMZN\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e), Alibaba\u0026rsquo;s online store takes no inventory risks. It also brings merchants\u0026rsquo; entire operations online, offering cloud applications as well as a cloud platform.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt was Alibaba\u0026rsquo;s efforts to deal with money as it deals with goods, in the form of subsidiary Ant Financial, that got it in trouble. Ant was making loans then selling off nearly all the risk. That won\u0026rsquo;t be allowed now, which reduces Ant\u0026rsquo;s risk to the financial system. But it cost Alibaba shareholders the potential for hundreds of billions in gains.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eStill, \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3135886/china-digital-currency-when-will-e-yuan-be-launched-and-what\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eadd in the digital yuan\u003c/a\u003e and Alibaba could quickly do what Facebook only dreams of doing with its diem cybercurrency. That is, eliminate settlement costs in transactions by moving the money instantly, doing away with settlement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAlibaba cloud\u0026rsquo;s moves to export its services face the same risk, namely \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.eu/article/alibaba-liege-airport-china-mega-project-debate/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003edistrust of Xi\u0026rsquo;s government\u003c/a\u003e, that Twitter does in Nigeria or India. But Alibaba\u0026rsquo;s cloud is \u003ca href=\"https://www.srgresearch.com/articles/cloud-market-ends-2020-high-while-microsoft-continues-gain-ground-amazon\" target=\"_blank\"\u003econtinuing to take market share\u003c/a\u003e, passing \u003cstrong\u003eIBM\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ibm-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIBM\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) to take fourth behind only Amazon, \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) and Google. It\u0026rsquo;s \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/05/28/alibaba-is-making-its-cloud-os-compatible-with-multiple-chip-architectures/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003econtinuing to innovate\u003c/a\u003e and it\u0026rsquo;s not losing money, either. Can Google Cloud say the same? (\u003ca href=\"https://abc.xyz/investor/static/pdf/2021Q1_alphabet_earnings_release.pdf?cache=0cd3d78\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eUh, no.\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eThe Bottom Line\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf you think Xi Jinping is a Communist, don\u0026rsquo;t even think about buying BABA stock.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf you think he\u0026rsquo;s no different than Trump, India\u0026rsquo;s Prime Minister Narendra Modi, or even Nigeria\u0026rsquo;s President Muhammandu Buhari, I see no reason to hold back.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNo other cloud stock is priced at just 5.3x revenue or 26x earnings. It\u0026rsquo;s not even close. Alibaba has also been through the government mill and survived.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI\u0026rsquo;ll be getting back in shortly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn the date of publication, Dana Blankenhorn held LONG positions in\u0026nbsp;MSFT, AMZN, JD, FB and AAPL.\u0026nbsp;The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ePublishing Guidelines\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.danablankenhorn.com/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eDana Blankenhorn\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e has been a financial and technology journalist since 1978. \u0026amp; Trading Tips\n\nThe 5G revolution isn’t just coming, it’s already here. However, many investors don’t seem to realize the opportunity that comes with","body":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe 5G revolution isn\u0026rsquo;t just coming, it\u0026rsquo;s already here. However, many investors don\u0026rsquo;t seem to realize the opportunity that comes with it. With an increase in data speed comes an increase in capabilities. It\u0026rsquo;s going to cause a wave of upgrades, ranging from handsets to infrastructure. And with that, we want to look for 5G stocks to buy.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSwitching to 5G should result in a burst of higher download speeds. It makes everything from streaming on the go to Internet of Things (IoT) devices more convenient. As a result, it\u0026rsquo;s going to exponentially increase the amount of data that is currently consumed.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile 5G technology was formally adopted in 2020, it\u0026rsquo;s really starting to hit its stride in 2021. That trend is only going to accelerate, particularly after the impact of the novel coronavirus.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/06/the-7-best-micro-cap-stocks-you-can-buy-now/\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\tThe 7 Best Micro-Cap Stocks You Can Buy Now\t\t\t\t\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCovid-19 created a dramatic acceleration in technology growth, and continued stimulus should also help. Thus, let\u0026rsquo;s look at seven 5G stocks now.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/aapl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAAPL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBroadcom\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/avgo-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAVGO\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eQualcomm\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/qcom-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eQCOM\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmerican Tower\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amt-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eVerizon\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/vz-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eVZ\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSkyWorks Solutions\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/swks-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSWKS\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAdvanced Micro Devices\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amd-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMD\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eNow, let\u0026rsquo;s dive in and take a closer look at each one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003e5G Stocks to Buy: Apple (AAPL)\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/aapl-stock-2-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"White Apple (AAPL) logo on glass with people in background\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: ZorroGabriel / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe have to start the list with Apple. It doesn\u0026rsquo;t matter that the company doesn\u0026rsquo;t operate the cell towers or build the 5G chips inside our devices. What matters is that Apple is the world\u0026rsquo;s most successful smartphone operator.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome may argue that other companies \u0026mdash; like Samsung \u0026mdash; belong at the top spot. I\u0026rsquo;m going with Apple, because it\u0026rsquo;s the most profitable. The company\u0026rsquo;s a financial juggernaut, commanding a $2.12 trillion market capitalization. Its profit and sales figures are so large it will make your head spin.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYet, the stock has gone nowhere for several quarters, as the share price is trading around the same levels it was in August 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast fall, Apple introduced its first 5G compatible iPhone, paving the way for a huge adoption of the new technology. As its largest profit-generator, the iPhone plays a massive role in Apple\u0026rsquo;s success. It\u0026rsquo;s also the main gateway to the company\u0026rsquo;s Services revenue, which has shown tremendous growth in the past couple of years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile Apple may not be creating the 5G revolution, its products are certainly helping to drive adoption of it. Look for this company to keep on winning in the long term too.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eBroadcom (AVGO)\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/AVGO1600-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"broadcom (AVGO) logo outside office building\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Sasima / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt one point, Broadcom was a major talking point. For whatever reason though, this name seems to have quietly slipped off investors\u0026rsquo; radar. I think that\u0026rsquo;s a mistake.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere\u0026rsquo;s more to this name than its 3.1% dividend yield, which was much higher before the stock\u0026rsquo;s rally over the past 12 months. The company is set for a solid year, too. Analysts expect 12.5% revenue growth and 21% earnings growth.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePerhaps the best part? Shares trade at a reasonable valuation, going out at 17 times this year\u0026rsquo;s earnings estimates. The company trades at a reasonable 15 times trailing free cash flow as well, as Broadcom has done an excellent job building out long-term drivers for its business with strong margins.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company began working on 5G capabilities years ago, realizing it would be a major driver in growth. It said, \u0026ldquo;\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.broadcom.com/company/news/product-releases/52186\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe 5G build-out is expected\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to require an increase in capacity of the mobile network by a factor of ten or more along with a simultaneous tightening of key requirements for each segment of the network.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/06/7-beaten-down-stocks-to-buy-right-now-june-rebound/\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t7 Beaten-Down Stocks to Buy Right Now for a June Rebound\t\t\t\t\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSo what did Broadcom do? Built out an end-to-end solution, of course. This is a name to keep on the radar.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003e5G Stocks to Buy: Qualcomm (QCOM)\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/qcom-stock-10-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"Qualcomm (QCOM) logo on the side of a building in San Jose, CA.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: jejim / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf we want to talk about the \u0026ldquo;guts\u0026rdquo; of 5G capabilities, there\u0026rsquo;s perhaps no better company to look at than Qualcomm. As a major chip manufacturer in smartphones, Qualcomm\u0026rsquo;s technology is key to the 5G revolution.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company focuses on a wide range of applications, too. That includes mobile broadband, but also mission-critical communications and the Internet of Things (IoT) thematic.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile Qualcomm has exposure to a plethora of industries, the current focus is on its 5G applications. From the company: \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u0026ldquo;We designed our Snapdragon 5G platforms to deliver a superior signal indoors and outdoors, with support for all key 5G technologies and frequencies, including mmWave and sub-6.\u0026rdquo;\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlthough Apple could eventually displace Qualcomm, for now, the latter is a major supplier to the former. Furthermore, consensus estimates call for almost 50% revenue growth this year, along with 85% earnings growth. Analysts also expect roughly double-digit top- and bottom-line growth next year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eAmerican Tower (AMT)\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/amt-stock-1-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"A magnifying glass zooms in on the American Tower (AMT) website.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Pavel Kapysh / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe 5G revolution should also have American Tower on investors\u0026rsquo; radar. Shares are currently hovering near multi-month highs, but are still below resistance and the one-year high near $270.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCurrently paying a yield of about 2%, this REIT is also one to benefit from the 5G revolution. While upgrades equate to capital expenses \u0026mdash; which impacts the next company on this list too \u0026mdash; it also solidifies these companies for the future of communication.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus, upgrades equate to more revenue and ensure recurring revenue for the future. As more of the world adopts 5G technology, buys IoT devices and turns to streaming TV, American Tower will be the one to make that happen.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/06/7-top-stocks-to-sell-for-june/\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t7 Top Stocks To Sell For June\t\t\t\t\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company is building the foundation of the 5G revolution by operating so many of the vital towers and infrastructure that is needed.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003e5G Stocks to Buy: Verizon (VZ)\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/vz-stock-10-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"5G stocks\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Ken Wolter / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eVerizon is a known dividend stud, kicking out a 4.4% yield. That\u0026rsquo;s considerable, even after the recent rise in bond yields. However, that\u0026rsquo;s one of Verizon\u0026rsquo;s more attractive qualities, given that it\u0026rsquo;s not exactly a high-growth stock.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnalysts expect 4.3% revenue growth this year and 2.1% growth next year. It\u0026rsquo;s similar on the earnings front, with estimates calling for 3.7% and 1.6% growth this year and next year, respectively.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut if there\u0026rsquo;s one thing investors can count on, it\u0026rsquo;s for customers to pay their phone bills. No one wants to lose their cell coverage and in Verizon\u0026rsquo;s case, the company takes \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.verizon.com/coverage-map/\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003egreat pride in its coverage\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith unlimited data offering including 5G coverage, it gives Verizon pricing power (not that it didn\u0026rsquo;t have pricing power before). But as the country moves toward 5G, it should put Verizon in a strong position to keep the revenue flowing in and the dividends flowing out.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eSkyWorks Solutions (SWKS)\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/swks-stock-1-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"the Skyworks (SWKS) website is loading on a smartphone\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: madamF / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhat does \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/company/SWKS:US#:~:text=Skyworks%20Solutions%2C%20Inc.,solutions%20for%20mobile%20communications%20applications.\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSkyworks Solutions do?\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e It\u0026rsquo;s a \u0026ldquo;wireless semiconductor company, designs and manufactures radio frequency and complete semiconductor system solutions for mobile communications applications.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs a supplier for Apple, Skyworks is riding the trend in smartphone upgrades, allowing 5G to help fuel its growth. That\u0026rsquo;s evident by consensus estimates too.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnalysts are looking for roughly 50% sales growth this year, outpaced only by analysts\u0026rsquo; expectations of almost 70% earnings growth. Should it come to fruition, it will leave Skyworks stock trading at about 16 times this year\u0026rsquo;s earnings.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNo debt and almost $1.5 billion in cash on its balance sheet also leaves Skyworks in a flexible position. However, that will have to change after its \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investors.skyworksinc.com/news-releases/news-release-details/skyworks-acquire-infrastructure-automotive-business-silicon-labs#:~:text=22%2C%202021%2D%2D%20Skyworks%20Solutions%2C%20Inc.\u0026amp;text=(Nasdaq%3A%20SLAB)%2C%20a,transaction%20valued%20at%20%242.75%20billion%20.\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$2.75 billion acquisition\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of Silicon Labs\u0026rsquo; infrastructure and automotive unit.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/06/7-hurricane-stocks-to-buy-for-the-stormy-season-coming-our-way-hd-gnrc-mpx-brk-b-low-mas-kmx/\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t7 Hurricane Stocks To Buy as a Higher-Than-Normal Season Kick's Off\t\t\t\t\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat said, the deal should help fuel the company\u0026rsquo;s longer term growth plans. Particularly as vehicle connectivity continues to increase \u0026mdash; another driver of 5G adoption.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003e5G Stocks to Buy: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/amd-stock-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) logo on blue background with Ryzen and Radeon brands\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" /\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Joseph GTK / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile AMD is not typically thought of as a 5G stock, that could be changing with the company\u0026rsquo;s acquisition of \u003cstrong\u003eXilinx\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/xlnx-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eXLNX\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAssuming AMD is able to close the $35 billion deal, it will help broaden the company\u0026rsquo;s reach. The deal was approved by shareholders in April. In late May, AMD sought EU approval of the deal.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf it closes, Xilinx could help put AMD in a favorable 5G position.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.fool.com/investing/stock-market/market-sectors/communication/5g-stocks/\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ecompany is\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e:\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u0026ldquo;The industry leader in field-programmable gate array (FPGA) chips. FPGA chips have flexible designs customers can reprogram and reconfigure even after they\u0026rsquo;ve been built. As new hardware is developed for 5G, FPGA chips\u0026rsquo; adaptability makes them ideal for constructing the basic equipment to deploy 5G technology.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNot to mention, AMD has very strong growth from its current business. Analysts expect revenue to climb 50% in 2021 and for earnings to jump 67%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn the date of publication, Bret Kenwell held a long position in AMD. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePublishing Guidelines\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBret Kenwell is the manager and author of \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://futurebluechips.substack.com/\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFuture Blue Chips\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and is on Twitter \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/BretKenwell\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003e@BretKenwell\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eMore From InvestorPlace\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/02/silicon-valley-whiz-kid-reveals-top-tech-stock/?cid=MKT516215\u0026amp;eid=MKT524303\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\tStock Prodigy Who Found NIO at $2\u0026hellip; Says Buy THIS Now\t\t\t\t\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/01/one-percenter-issues-urgent-warning/?cid=MKT499868\u0026amp;eid=MKT513141\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\tIt doesn\u0026rsquo;t matter if you have $500 in savings or $5 million. xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"PRN_ImbeddedAssetReference\" xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"PRNURL\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/thinking-about-trading-options-or-stock-in-apple-carnival-corp-alibaba-seagate-technology-or-spirit-airlines-301291753.html\"\u003ehttp://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/thinking-about-trading-options-or-stock-in-apple-carnival-corp-alibaba-seagate-technology-or-spirit-airlines-301291753.html\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSOURCE  InvestorsObserver\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21129022","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Opinion"},{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL","BABA","CCL","SAVE","STX"],"tags":[{"name":"Banking/Financial Services"}]},"21151539":{"id":21151539,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 17 May 2021 09:00:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 17 May 2021 09:00:19 -0400","title":"Apple Music Announces Spatial Audio with Dolby Atmos; Will Bring Lossless Audio to Entire Catalog","teaser":"\nThe next generation of sound on Apple Music is coming to subscribers June 2021 at no additional cost\n\nApple® today announced Apple Music® is bringing industry-leading sound quality to subscribers with the","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe next generation of sound on Apple Music is coming to subscribers June 2021 at no additional cost\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today announced Apple Music\u0026#xAE; is bringing industry-leading sound quality to subscribers with the addition of Spatial Audio with support for Dolby Atmos. Spatial Audio gives artists the opportunity to create immersive audio experiences for their fans with true multidimensional sound and clarity. Apple Music subscribers will also be able to listen to more than 75 million songs in Lossless Audio — the way the artists created them in the studio. These new features will be available for Apple Music subscribers starting next month at no additional cost.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210517005301/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210517005301/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 378px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210517005301/en/878818/4/Apple_iphone12_jbalvin-apple-music-screen_051021.jpg\" alt=\"Spatial Audio with Dolby Atmos and Lossless Audio are coming to Apple Music subscribers beginning June 2021. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003eSpatial Audio with Dolby Atmos and Lossless Audio are coming to Apple Music subscribers beginning June 2021. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"Apple Music is making its biggest advancement ever in sound quality,\" said Oliver Schusser, Apple's vice president of Apple Music and Beats\u0026#xAE;. \"Listening to a song in Dolby Atmos is like magic. The music comes from all around you and sounds incredible. Now we are bringing this truly innovative and immersive experience to our listeners with music from their favorite artists like J Balvin, Gustavo Dudamel, Ariana Grande, Maroon 5, Kacey Musgraves, The Weeknd, and so many more. Subscribers will also be able to listen to their music in the highest audio quality with Lossless Audio. Apple Music as we know it is about to change forever.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSpatial Audio with Support for Dolby Atmos\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple is bringing Spatial Audio with support for Dolby Atmos to Apple Music. Dolby Atmos is a revolutionary, immersive audio experience that enables artists to mix music so the sound comes from all around and from above the listener. By default, Apple Music will automatically play Dolby Atmos tracks on all AirPods\u0026#xAE; and Beats headphones with an H1 or W1 chip, as well as the built-in speakers in the latest versions of iPhone\u0026#xAE;, iPad\u0026#xAE;, and Mac\u0026#xAE;. Apple Music will be adding new Dolby Atmos tracks constantly and will be curating a special set of Dolby Atmos playlists to help listeners find the music they love. In addition, albums that are available in Dolby Atmos will have a badge on the detail page for easy discovery.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nAt launch, subscribers can enjoy thousands of songs in Spatial Audio from some of the world's biggest artists and music across all genres, including hip-hop, country, Latin, pop, and classical. Apple Music is working with artists and labels to add new releases and the best catalog tracks, as more artists begin to create music specifically for the Spatial Audio experience. Together, Apple Music and Dolby are making it easy for musicians, producers, and mix engineers to create songs in Dolby Atmos. Initiatives include doubling the number of Dolby-enabled studios in major markets, offering educational programs, and providing resources to independent artists.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"Today marks the introduction of Dolby Atmos on Apple Music — a new music experience that is transforming how music is created by artists and enjoyed by their fans,\" said Kevin Yeaman, Dolby Laboratories' president and CEO. \"We are working with Apple Music to make Dolby Atmos widely available to all musicians and anyone who loves music.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nJ Balvin said: \"I'm really excited to be part of this project with Apple Music because I always want to be a step ahead and I think this is one of those steps. With Lossless, everything in the music is going to sound bigger and stronger but more importantly, it will be better quality. Hearing myself and my music in Dolby Atmos for the first time, it was just crazy, it blew my mind, it's indescribable. I think fans will really love this new experience.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nGustavo Dudamel said: \"There are no words to describe the immersive, overpowering experience of being a conductor, leading a performance of Mahler's towering ‘Symphony of a Thousand.' But now, technology is advancing to bring that experience closer to our ears, our minds, and our souls. Share with me this monumental, live performance with my beloved Los Angeles Philharmonic, remastered in Dolby Atmos audio technology for the first time on Apple Music alongside my collection of Deutsche Grammophon recordings with the LA Phil, in rich, remarkable 3D sound.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nGrammy Award-winning producer, songwriter, and composer Giles Martin said: \"Since recording began, artists, producers, and engineers have tried to paint pictures with sound, transporting listeners to worlds they never knew existed, even when the sound came from a single speaker. Now with the dawn of immersive audio, we can take the music lover inside the music. From the feeling of hearing your favorite artist in the same room as you, to the experience of sitting directly in the middle of a symphony orchestra, the listening experience is transformative and the possibilities for the creator are endless. This is a quantum leap in technology — I have so far had the pleasure of mixing some of the greatest artists in history in Dolby Atmos. With this work I have found myself falling into albums I love. There is a unique experience of being able to fully immerse myself in music that, although is familiar, suddenly sounds new, fresh, and immediate. As a creator, it is beyond exciting that we can now share this incredible experience through Apple Music.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nMixing engineer Manny Marroquin said: \"Spatial Audio gives music a new identity. Every time I mix in Atmos it gives me goosebumps. The future has arrived.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eLossless Audio\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple Music will also make its catalog of more than 75 million songs available in Lossless Audio. Apple uses ALAC (Apple Lossless Audio Codec) to preserve every single bit of the original audio file. This means Apple Music subscribers will be able to hear the exact same thing that the artists created in the studio.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nTo start listening to Lossless Audio, subscribers using the latest version of Apple Music can turn it on in Settings \u0026gt; Music \u0026gt; Audio Quality. Here, they can choose different resolutions for different connections such as cellular, Wi-Fi, or for download. Apple Music's Lossless tier starts at CD quality, which is 16 bit at 44.1 kHz (kilohertz), and goes up to 24 bit at 48 kHz and is playable natively on Apple devices. For the true audiophile, Apple Music also offers Hi-Resolution Lossless all the way up to 24 bit at 192 kHz.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nProducer Piper Payne said: \"The soul and life of the mix is sitting in the extra bits of data that are stored in the lossless file. As a mastering engineer, having the ability to convey the music to the listener at its highest quality is the end goal of what I work for every day.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAvailability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSpatial Audio with support for Dolby Atmos and Lossless Audio will be available to Apple Music subscribers at no additional cost.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThousands of tracks will be available in Spatial Audio with Dolby Atmos at launch, with more added regularly.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple Music's catalog of more than 75 million songs will be available in Lossless Audio.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nMore information, including a comprehensive list of compatible devices, is available at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fapple-music%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52430382\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210517005301\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=apple.com%2Fapple-music%2F\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=3c13ba9f46c8525b923d0d6cbab361b4\" shape=\"rect\"\u003eapple.com/apple-music/\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003eDue to the large file sizes and bandwidth needed for Lossless and Hi-Res Lossless Audio, subscribers will need to opt in to the experience. Hi-Res Lossless also requires external equipment, such as a USB digital-to-analog converter (DAC).\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAbout Apple Music\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple loves music. With iPod\u0026#xAE; and iTunes\u0026#xAE;, Apple revolutionized the music experience by putting a thousand songs in your pocket. Today, Apple Music takes this to the ultimate with over 75 million songs, thousands of playlists, and daily selections from the world's best music experts, including all of the artists and hosts broadcasting daily across its Apple Music 1℠, Apple Music Hits, and Apple Music Country global live streams. Since 2015, Apple Music has welcomed tens of millions of subscribers in 167 countries and regions. Streaming seamlessly to iPhone, iPad, iPod, Apple Watch\u0026#xAE;, Apple TV\u0026#xAE;, Mac, HomePod\u0026#xAE;, and CarPlay\u0026#xAE;, Apple Music is the most complete music experience on the planet. Apple Music is also available on popular smart TVs, smart speakers, Android and Windows devices, and more — as well as online at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fmusic.apple.com\u0026amp;esheet=52430382\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210517005301\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=music.apple.com\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=878e8d3561efe47bf6ade8b9a6e6afff\" shape=\"rect\"\u003emusic.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52430382\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210517005301\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=94c85c7d932d9f3f8d0529fae42edbcc\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, the Apple logo, Apple Music, Beats, AirPods, iPhone, iPad, Mac, iPod, iTunes, Apple Watch, Apple TV, HomePod, CarPlay, and Apple Music 1 are trademarks of Apple. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210517005301r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" style=\"width:0;height:0\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwct31415\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210517005301/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210517005301/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21151539","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21151544":{"id":21151544,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 17 May 2021 09:00:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 17 May 2021 09:00:20 -0400","title":"Apple Watch Pride Edition Bands Celebrate and Support the Diverse LGBTQ+ Movement","teaser":"\nNew Braided Solo Loop represents the breadth of LGBTQ+ communities and experiences\n\nSince the introduction of Apple Watch® Pride Edition in 2016, Apple®\u0026#39;s unique Pride bands have been a visible illustration of","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew Braided Solo Loop represents the breadth of LGBTQ+ communities and experiences\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSince the introduction of Apple Watch\u0026#xAE; Pride Edition in 2016, Apple\u0026#xAE;'s unique Pride bands have been a visible illustration of the ways in which the company stands with, supports, and is proudly made up of members of the LGBTQ+ community. Today, on International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia, and Biphobia (IDAHOT), Apple debuts a new Apple Watch Pride Edition band and dynamic watch face, both of which incorporate a broader set of colors inspired by multiple Pride flags that have represented the diverse LGBTQ+ community throughout its rich history. Recognizing that inclusion and equity are core goals of the LGBTQ+ movement, and that diverse and multiracial activists have been at the heart of this community from the start, this year's offering honors that history as well as the work still ahead.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"Even before the events at the Stonewall Inn brought the LGBTQ+ movement to new prominence, Black, Brown, and transgender activists were key leaders in the march toward equality,\" said Tim Cook, Apple's CEO. \"On many fronts, Apple supports the ongoing and unfinished work of equality for diverse and intersectional communities, and we want to provide every opportunity to celebrate and honor this history during Pride season.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith this latest introduction, Apple is proud to build on its long-running financial support for LGBTQ+ advocacy organizations working to bring about positive change, including Encircle, Equality North Carolina, Equality Texas, Gender Spectrum, GLSEN, Human Rights Campaign, National Center for Transgender Equality, PFLAG National, SMYAL, and The Trevor Project in the US, as well as ILGA World internationally.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eDesign\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe Pride Edition Braided Solo Loop artfully weaves together the original rainbow colors with those drawn from various Pride flags to represent the breadth of diversity among LGBTQ+ experiences and the history of a movement that has spanned generations. Black and brown symbolize Black and Latinx communities, in addition to those who have passed away from or are living with HIV/AIDS, while light blue, pink, and white represent transgender and nonbinary individuals. The unique band features stretchable recycled yarn interwoven with silicon threads, designed for ultracomfort without buckles or clasps. To ensure the best fit, customers can choose from 12 available lengths of the Braided Solo Loop.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePride Watch Face\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThis year's special Pride watch face beautifully mirrors the new colors of the band to represent the combined strength and mutual support of the LGBTQ+ movement. With the rotation of the Digital Crown, the threads on the watch face infinitely scroll and animate with a raise of the wrist. For the first time, Apple is also including new App Clip\u0026#x2122; functionality within the band packaging to deliver a simple and convenient way for customers to immediately access the new matching watch face.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePride Edition Nike Sport Loop\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nA new Pride Edition Nike Sport Loop showcases six colors of the original rainbow, and utilizes reflective yarn to aid those engaging in outdoor workouts at night like running, cycling, and walking. The comfortable design is durable, infinitely adjustable for the perfect fit, and pairs nicely with a corresponding Nike watch face.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePricing and Availability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe Pride Edition Braided Solo Loop is $99 (US) and the Pride Edition Nike Sport Loop is $49 (US).\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe new Pride Edition bands are available to order today from apple.com and the Apple Store\u0026#xAE; app, and will be available at Apple Store locations beginning May 25. The Pride Edition Nike Sport Loop is also coming soon to nike.com.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe Pride Edition Braided Solo Loop is compatible with Apple Watch SE and Apple Watch Series 4 or later, while the Pride Edition Nike Sport Loop is compatible with Apple Watch Series 3 or later.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe 2021 Pride watch face is coming soon as part of a software update.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApp Clip codes require iOS 14.3 or later.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52430346\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210517005285\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=00259ff168fea41d912a0ec376709a9e\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210517005285r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210517005285/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210517005285/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21151544","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21151577":{"id":21151577,"author":"PRNewswire","created":"Mon, 17 May 2021 09:00:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 17 May 2021 09:00:27 -0400","title":"The Best Ways To Play The Electric Vehicle Boom","teaser":"LONDON, May 17, 2021 /PRNewswire/ -- Electric vehicle sales jumped 43% in 2020 while overall car sales decreased by 20%, and there\u0026#39;s still plenty of room to run on the electric playing field, according to some of the","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-location\"\u003eLONDON\u003c/span\u003e, \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-chron\"\u003eMay 17, 2021\u003c/span\u003e /PRNewswire/ -- Electric vehicle sales jumped 43% in 2020 while overall car sales decreased by 20%, and there\u0026#39;s still plenty of room to run on the electric playing field, according to some of the biggest wealth managers, but there\u0026#39;s a potential big industry disruptor here …   Mentioned in today\u0026#39;s commentary includes:  \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTesla, Inc.\u003c/b\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNIO Inc.\u003c/b\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NIO#NYSE\"\u003eNIO\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eApple Inc.\u003c/b\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eToyota Motor Corporation\u003c/b\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TM#NYSE\"\u003eTM\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eBlink Charging Co.\u003c/b\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/BLNK#NASDAQ\"\u003eBLNK\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eOne of the next big shake-ups in the auto industry - and one that will help, not hinder the adoption of EVs - is the burgeoning car subscription business. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThe car subscription market is set to top \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/car-subscription-market-to-reach-12-09-bn-globally-by-2027-at-23-1-cagr-allied-market-research-301247122.html%26amp;sa%3DD%26amp;source%3Deditors%26amp;ust%3D1617668556788000%26amp;usg%3DAOvVaw0IhA0cFe0Ed1BgvYBZxiCJ\u0026amp;sa=D\u0026amp;source=editors\u0026amp;ust=1617668556821000\u0026amp;usg=AOvVaw3UnQjbBQSl1_3PkL3Emb2B\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-money\"\u003e$12 billion\u003c/span\u003e by 2027\u003c/a\u003e, and many of the big car makers are making moves on it, from Porsche to Volvo … and even to Hertz itself, since there is a big opportunity here. But \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://www.steerev.com%26amp;sa%3DD%26amp;source%3Deditors%26amp;ust%3D1617668556789000%26amp;usg%3DAOvVaw0yjdldO4d-rWhSU4RD0pRt\u0026amp;sa=D\u0026amp;source=editors\u0026amp;ust=1617668556821000\u0026amp;usg=AOvVaw2btXni8TvojBVs5zBmzUfz\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://www.steerev.com%26amp;sa%3DD%26amp;source%3Deditors%26amp;ust%3D1617668556789000%26amp;usg%3DAOvVaw0yjdldO4d-rWhSU4RD0pRt\u0026amp;sa=D\u0026amp;source=editors\u0026amp;ust=1617668556821000\u0026amp;usg=AOvVaw2btXni8TvojBVs5zBmzUfz\u003c/a\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://www.steerev.com%26amp;sa%3DD%26amp;source%3Deditors%26amp;ust%3D1617668556789000%26amp;usg%3DAOvVaw0yjdldO4d-rWhSU4RD0pRt\u0026amp;sa=D\u0026amp;source=editors\u0026amp;ust=1617668556821000\u0026amp;usg=AOvVaw2btXni8TvojBVs5zBmzUfz\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-location\"\u003eWashington, D.C.\u003c/span\u003e-based Steer\u003c/a\u003e combines two big trends: subscriptions and EVs, making it one to watch in this sector.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20200908005359/en/Facedrive-Acquires-Steer-and-Accepts-Strategic-Investment-From-Exelon-Subsidiary-Exelorate%26amp;sa%3DD%26amp;source%3Deditors%26amp;ust%3D1617668556789000%26amp;usg%3DAOvVaw0k9GZ-zn7rnAV5qskgvEoK\u0026amp;sa=D\u0026amp;source=editors\u0026amp;ust=1617668556822000\u0026amp;usg=AOvVaw2n0QDa97zR7Wj_mNqbr0-g\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAcquired by Canadian Facedrive\u003c/a\u003e in Q3 2020, Steer - like Facedrive itself - is all about getting out in front of the newest trends, first…And turning carbon-offset offerings into profitable tech-driven verticals. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFacedrive\u0026#39;s Steer (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/FD.V\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eFD\u003c/a\u003e; \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/FDVRF\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eFDVRF\u003c/a\u003e)\u003ci xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e knows\u003c/i\u003e a lot about millennials. They \u003ci xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eare\u003c/i\u003e millennials. And many millennials just don\u0026#39;t like to buy and own. They are far too dynamic for that. Leases were already becoming a favorite for many millennials as far back as 2016 when \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://musaautofinance.com/for-millennials-leasing-is-the-new-buying/%26amp;sa%3DD%26amp;source%3Deditors%26amp;ust%3D1617668556791000%26amp;usg%3DAOvVaw08iiYapYLdO9pGYC3f6aGW\u0026amp;sa=D\u0026amp;source=editors\u0026amp;ust=1617668556822000\u0026amp;usg=AOvVaw3e_HSPBu1ddqEnWeeeQfwi\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e34%\u003c/a\u003e of them chose leases over financing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAn EV Garage At the Touch of a Button \u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSteer is a new all-inclusive, monthly, low-risk car subscription service that features 100% electric, plug-in, and hybrid vehicles. And the company was created with an overriding ambition: To take the EV industry one step further by helping to change the way people view car ownership, forever…Let\u0026#39;s not mince words, here: The car ownership experience is woefully lacking. From the annoyance of haggling with that special breed of car dealers… to the hassle of shopping for, paying for, and attempting to understand the nuances of insurance… to myriad financing options, all of which tie to you a car you don\u0026#39;t want to be committed to for so long… \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThere was minimal flexibility in this market until the advent of subscriptions.And there were very few carbon-offset subscription options for that rapidly growing lineup of new EVs… until Steer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSteer is one of the answers to the last remaining hurdle of full-on adoption of EVs: cost and charging technology. A subscription to Steer comes with your own concierge who delivers your car wherever you need it and assists with charging, either at home or on the road. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eWith Steer, members get their own virtual gallery to fit various budgets, including everything from the Audi e-Tron and the Hyundai Kona to your favorite Tesla, and beyond. And the growth runways are excellent when you consider that 70% of Steer members have never even driven an EV before. That means that these are new converts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThe Next Phase of Change \u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFacedrive (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/FD.V\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eFD\u003c/a\u003e; \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/FDVRF\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eFDVRF\u003c/a\u003e)\u003ci xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/i\u003eacquired Steer from Exelon (EXC) in a deal that included a \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-money\"\u003e$2-million\u003c/span\u003e strategic investment by energy giant Exelon\u0026#39;s wholly-owned subsidiary, Exelorate Enterprises, LLC.Together, they could pose a positive challenge to an auto industry that\u0026#39;s already trying to adapt to the changing EV industry. And the leaders are emerging as those who can do two things: tie their business into the \u0026#34;ESG megatrend\u0026#34;, where big money is starting to flow; and understand what today\u0026#39;s market wants: on-demand service and dynamic options. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSteer\u0026#39;s seamless, hassle-free technology and its lineup of hot EVs do both. It\u0026#39;s what some are calling a Netflix style of new car use. In the meantime, Facedrive is all about clean, tech-driven verticals, and Steer is just one. Facedrive recognized the need for a big energy-related lifestyle change long before it became a \u0026#34;trend\u0026#34;.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eIt was developing an answer to the pollution of companies like Uber and Lyft way back in 2016 and launched the first carbon-offset ride-sharing platform in 2019 in \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-location\"\u003eCanada\u003c/span\u003e, giving riders a choice of EV or hybrid and planting trees in cooperation with local authorities along the way. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eToday, in the name of corporate responsibility in a time of pandemic, Facedrive is focusing more aggressively on Steer, carbon-offset food and pharma deliveries, and TraceSCAN, the \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-location\"\u003eOntario\u003c/span\u003e government-backed COVID contact-tracing wearable technology that is aiming for rapid manufacture and deployment to help enable essential workers to get back on the job - safely - and in turn to help enable the economy to reopen, and stay open.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThere\u0026#39;s an important shift happening in consumer behavior, and Facedrive (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/FD.V\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eFD\u003c/a\u003e; \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/FDVRF\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eFDVRF\u003c/a\u003e)\u003ci xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/i\u003eintends to be out in front of it all the way. In our view, this is definitely one stock to watch closely. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eOther companies to watch as the electric vehicle boom accelerates: \u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTesla Inc. (TSLA)\u003c/b\u003e emerged as the stock story of 2020. Throughout the year, the de facto king of electric vehicles dominated headlines and defied expectations. Tesla has continued to defy bearish expectations that low oil prices would put a damper on its core business of selling electric vehicles. Despite this, for the fourth consecutive quarter, the EV maker posted yet another blowout that beat top-and bottom-line expectations. More importantly, it exceeded Wall Street delivery estimates and reported record profits to boot. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eArmed with slick cars, game-changing technology and an out of this world  CEO, Tesla had its eye on prize long before the green energy hype started building. In fact, the company released the first Tesla Roadster over a decade ago, making electric vehicles cool when people were laughing at first-gen electric vehicles. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThe meteoric rise by Tesla stock has seen CEO \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eElon Musk\u003c/span\u003e leapfrog several billionaires including \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eBill Gates\u003c/span\u003e to become the second-richest man on earth with a net worth of over \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-money\"\u003e$155 billion\u003c/span\u003e. And if things keep going the way they\u0026#39;re going, there\u0026#39;s a very good chance that this year, Musk could surpass even \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eJeff Bezos\u003c/span\u003e to become the richest man in the world. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eIt wasn\u0026#39;t so long ago that analysts and investors alike were ready to write off their losses and give up on electric vehicle manufacturer \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNio Inc (NIO)…\u003c/b\u003eIn fact, there were even rumors that the automaker was on the brink of bankruptcy. But the Chinese Tesla rival powered on, blew away estimates, and most importantly, kept its balance sheet in line. And its efforts have paid off - in a big way. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNio has made all the right moves over the past year to turn heads on the streets and in the marketplace... From its stunningly beautiful - and fast - EP9 supercar to its new line of family-friendly high-performance sedans, Nio is well on its way to retaking control of its local market from \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eElon Musk\u0026#39;s\u003c/span\u003e electric vehicle giant. And as Chinese EV sales continue to soar…Nio\u0026#39;s already-impressive ascension to electric superstar is only going to accelerate from here. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eOn \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-chron\"\u003eJanuary 1st, 2020\u003c/span\u003e, Nio was trading at just \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-money\"\u003e$3.24\u003c/span\u003e per share…But after reporting a record number of deliveries, launching its revolutionary \u0026#34;Battery-as-a-service\u0026#34; platform, and a multi-billion-dollar bump from Chinese investors, the company\u0026#39;s stock price skyrocketed by 1604%, starting off the year at \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-money\"\u003e$59\u003c/span\u003e per share, before falling back to earth and settling at its current price. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eApple (\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAAPL)\u003c/b\u003e, has always been a pioneer in the tech world. Ex-CEO \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eSteve Jobs\u003c/span\u003e paved the way to a greener future for the company and the industry as a whole.  From the products themselves, to the packages they came in, and even the data centers powering them, \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eSteve Jobs\u003c/span\u003e went above and beyond to cut the environmental impact of his company. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eApple has made significant moves towards renewables. All of Apple\u0026#39;s operations run on 100% renewable energy, and it is even extending this philosophy to its distributors and manufacturers. Not only have they decreased their average product\u0026#39;s energy use by 70 percent. They\u0026#39;ve reduced their total carbon footprint by more than 35 percent in just a few short years. All while securing the title as the World\u0026#39;s First Trillion Dollar Company. And it\u0026#39;s not ignoring the EV boom, either. \u0026#34;We\u0026#39;re focusing on autonomous systems. It\u0026#39;s a core technology that we view as very important. We sort of see it as the mother of all AI projects. It\u0026#39;s probably one of the most difficult AI projects actually to work on.\u0026#34; Apple CEO \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eTim Cook\u003c/span\u003e on Apple\u0026#39;s plans in the car space. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eInvestors shouldn\u0026#39;t ignore legacy automakers, either.\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e Toyota Motors (\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTM)\u003c/b\u003e is a multi-national automaker who hasn\u0026#39;t ignored the massive shift in the transportation business. In fact, it was ahead of the curve, even. The Toyota Prius was one of the first hybrids to hit the road in a big way. While the legacy hybrid vehicle has been the butt of many jokes throughout the years, the car has been a major success, and more importantly, it helped spur the adoption of greener vehicles over the past decade. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u0026#34;We continue to be leaders in electrification that began with our pioneering introduction of the Prius nearly 25 years ago,\u0026#34; said \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eBob Carter\u003c/span\u003e, TMNA executive vice president of sales. \u0026#34;Toyota\u0026#39;s new electrified product offerings will give customers multiple choices of powertrain that best suits their needs.\u0026#34; \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThough the Prius hasn\u0026#39;t exactly aged as well as some green competitors, Toyota hasn\u0026#39;t left the green power race yet. Just a few weeks ago, actually, the giant automaker announced that three new electric vehicles will soon be coming to \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-location\"\u003eUnited States\u003c/span\u003e markets \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTesla\u0026#39;s success has also fueled a boom in other EV-related companies\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e. Blink (BLNK)\u003c/b\u003e, for example, an electric vehicle charging company, has risen by over 300% in just a few months, and the sky is the limit for this up-and-comer. A wave of new deals, including a collaboration with EnerSys and another with Envoy Technologies to deploy electric vehicoes and charging stations adds further support.  Aric Ohana, CEO of Envoy noted, \u0026#34;We\u0026#39;re excited to work with Blink on the deployment of their fast Level 2 charging stations as part of our exclusive electric car-sharing service. The vision of our two companies is aligned: to advance the adoption of electric vehicles. To continue to drive the growth and success across our expanding locations, we have to ensure that our clients have easy and efficient access to high-quality, reliable charging equipment. Blink has an established reputation as an innovator in the EV market, and we are thrilled to add them as a preferred partner.\u0026#34; \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eMichael D. Farkas\u003c/span\u003e, for his part, the founder, CEO and Executive Chairman of Blink noted, \u0026#34;This is an exciting collaboration with EnerSys because it combines the industry-leading technologies of our two companies to provide user-friendly, high powered, next-generation charging alternatives. We are continuously innovating our product offerings to provide more efficient and convenient charging options to the growing community of EV drivers.\u0026#34;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eBy \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-person\"\u003eEd Johnson\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;IMPORTANT! BY READING OUR CONTENT YOU EXPLICITLY AGREE TO THE FOLLOWING. PLEASE READ CAREFULLY\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eForward-Looking Statements\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThis publication contains forward-looking information which is subject to a variety of risks and uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual events or results to differ from those projected in the forward-looking statements.  Forward looking statements in this publication include that subscription based car services for ride sharing services will help with the adoption of EVs; that millennials will like the flexibility of a subscription based car service for ride sharing; that subscription based ride sharing services will create flexibility and a carbon reduced option in the auto industry; that Facedrive and Steer will pose a positive challenge to the auto industry; that Facedrive and Steer will emerge as leaders in the business of car subscription services for ride sharing; that there will be an important shift in consumer behavior and Facedrive will be in front of it; and that Tracescan will be mass manufactured and will help get workers back on the job. These forward-looking statements are subject to a variety of risks and uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual events or results to differ materially from those projected in the forward-looking information.  Risks that could change or prevent these statements from coming to fruition include that subscription based car services for ride sharing may not help the adoption of EVs; that subscription based ride sharing services may not be popular with millennials or others as anticipated or at all; that ride sharing subscription services may not become widely accepted or used by consumers; that Facedrive and Steer may not emerge as leaders in the business of car subscription ride sharing as anticipated or at all; that there may not be a shift in consumer behavior leading to increased popularity in ride sharing subscription services and that such services may not gain the anticipated or even any popularity among consumers; even if they do, Facedrive may not be able to profit or become a profitable company. The forward-looking information contained herein is given as of the date hereof and we assume no responsibility to update or revise such information to reflect new events or circumstances, except as required by law.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eDISCLAIMERS\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThis communication is not a recommendation to buy or sell securities.
