PLEASE READ CAREFULLY\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eForward-Looking Statements\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eThis publication contains forward-looking information which is subject to a variety of risks and uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual events or results to differ from those projected in the forward-looking statements. Forward looking statements in this publication include that the global demand for ammonia and hydrogen as commodities will continue to increase; that the research and development in the energy sector will lead to adoption of hydrogen and ammonia as commercially viable fuel sources for the automotive, aircraft, marine, industrial or other sectors in the future; that governments will continue to implement initiatives supporting reduced carbon emissions and that ammonia and hydrogen will gain traction and commercial viability as potential carbon-free or low carbon fuel alternatives; that AMMP will be able to develop an efficient process and proprietary intellectual property for the production of green ammonia and that AMMP\u0026#39;s process, if developed, will be adopted commercially to allow use of green ammonia and/or hydrogen as a viable fuel sources; that AMMP will meet its proposed development program and funding milestones to develop its technology process and produce the proposed AMMP power units; that AMMP will be able to establish its proposed manufacturing facility and produce ammonia power units which will be sold as commercially viable fuel alternatives; that investors will continue to seek opportunities for investment in green technologies and that hydrogen and ammonia will be considered as viable investment opportunities in the future; and that AMMP can carry out its business plans. These forward-looking statements are subject to a variety of risks and uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual events or results to differ materially from those projected in the forward-looking information.  Risks that could change or prevent these statements from coming to fruition include the global demand for ammonia and hydrogen may not actually continue to increase if other energy alternatives such as solar, wind or hydroelectric are favored over ammonia and hydrogen; that the research and development in the energy sector may lead to rejection of hydrogen and ammonia as commercially viable fuel sources for the automotive, aircraft, marine, industrial or other sectors in the future, and that research may find that other fuels or energy sources provide safer, more cost efficient and/or more viable fuel alternatives; that governments may not implement the anticipated funding and initiatives to support reduced carbon emissions sufficient for ammonia and hydrogen to gain necessary traction or commercial viability as fuel alternatives; that AMMP may be unable to develop an efficient process or any unique proprietary intellectual property for the production of green ammonia or, even if developed, may ultimately fail to be adopted as commercially viable for various reasons; that AMMP may be unable meet its proposed development timeline and funding milestones to develop its technology process and produce the proposed AMMP power units; that AMMP may be unable to establish its proposed manufacturing facility and produce ammonia power units, or if such units are developed, that they may not be sold as commercially viable fuel alternatives; that investors favour other clean energy opportunities than hydrogen and ammonia or that other fuel alternatives such as solar, wind and hydroelectric may be considered more commercially viable; and that AMMP may, for any number of reasons, fail to carry out its intended business plans. xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"PRN_ImbeddedAssetReference\" xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSOURCE  InvestorsObserver\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21451528","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Opinion"},{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL","BIIB","DIS","MRNA","TLRY"],"tags":[{"name":"Banking/Financial Services"}]},"21458390":{"id":21458390,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:01 -0400","title":"iOS 15 Brings New Ways to Stay Connected and Powerful Features That Help Users Focus, Explore, and Do More with On-device Intelligence","teaser":"\nApple previews major updates to FaceTime, new Focus features to reduce distraction, enhanced on-device intelligence to discover information, and more ways to explore the world using Maps, Weather, and","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple previews major updates to FaceTime, new Focus features to reduce distraction, enhanced on-device intelligence to discover information, and more ways to explore the world using Maps, Weather, and Wallet\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today announced iOS 15, a major update with powerful features that enhance the iPhone\u0026#xAE; experience. iOS 15 makes FaceTime\u0026#xAE; calls more natural, introduces SharePlay\u0026#x2122; for shared experiences, helps users focus and be in the moment with new ways to manage notifications, and brings more intelligence to photos and search to quickly access information. Apple Maps unveils beautiful new ways to explore the world, Weather is redesigned with full-screen maps and more graphical displays of data, Wallet adds support for home keys and ID cards, and browsing the internet with Safari\u0026#xAE; is even simpler with a new tab bar design and Tab Groups. iOS 15 also includes new privacy controls in Siri\u0026#xAE;, Mail, and more places across the system to further protect user information.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005654/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005654/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 480px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210607005654/en/883204/4/Apple_iPhone12Pro-iOS15-3up_060721.jpg\" alt=\"iOS 15 introduces SharePlay in FaceTime, Live Text using on-device intelligence, redesigned Notifications, and more. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003eiOS 15 introduces SharePlay in FaceTime, Live Text using on-device intelligence, redesigned Notifications, and more. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"For many customers, iPhone has become indispensable, and this year we've created even more ways it can enhance our daily lives,\" said Craig Federighi, Apple's senior vice president of Software Engineering. \"iOS 15 helps users stay connected while sharing experiences in real time, gives them new tools to help reduce distraction and find focus, uses intelligence to enhance the photos experience, and, with huge upgrades to Maps, brings new ways to explore the world. We can't wait for customers to experience it.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eMore Natural FaceTime Calls and Shared Experiences with SharePlay\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nFaceTime helps customers easily connect with those who matter most and with iOS 15, conversations with friends and family feel even more natural. With spatial audio, voices in a FaceTime call sound as if they are coming from where the person is positioned on the screen,\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e and new microphone modes separate the user's voice from background noise. Inspired by the stunning portrait photos taken on iPhone, Portrait mode is now available for FaceTime and designed specifically for video calls, so users can blur their background and put themselves in focus.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2\u003c/sup\u003e While using Group FaceTime, a new grid view enables participants to see more faces at the same time.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nUsers can now share experiences with SharePlay while connecting with friends on FaceTime, including listening to songs together with Apple Music\u0026#xAE;, watching a TV show or movie in sync, or sharing their screen to view apps together. SharePlay works across iPhone, iPad\u0026#xAE;, and Mac\u0026#xAE;, and with shared playback controls, anyone in a SharePlay session can play, pause, or jump ahead. SharePlay even extends to Apple TV\u0026#xAE;, so users can watch shows or movies on a big screen while connecting over FaceTime, and SharePlay will keep everyone's playback in sync. Disney+, ESPN+, HBO Max, Hulu, MasterClass, Paramount+, Pluto TV, TikTok, Twitch, and many others are integrating SharePlay into their apps — creating entirely new ways to connect.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nFaceTime calls also extend beyond Apple devices with the ability to create a link from iPhone, iPad, or Mac, and share it through Messages, Calendar, Mail, or third-party apps, so anyone can join a FaceTime call from their web browser on Android and Windows devices.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e3\u003c/sup\u003e FaceTime calls on the web remain end-to-end encrypted, so privacy is not compromised.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTools to Find Focus\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niOS 15 delivers powerful tools that help users focus and reduce distraction. Focus is a new feature that filters notifications and apps based on what a user wants to focus on. Customers can set their device to help them be in the moment by creating a custom Focus or selecting a suggested Focus, which uses on-device intelligence to suggest which people and apps are allowed to notify them. Focus suggestions are based on users' context, like during their work hours or while they're winding down for bed, and when Focus is set on one Apple device, it automatically applies to their other Apple devices. Users can create Home Screen pages with apps and widgets that apply to moments of focus to only display relevant apps and reduce temptation. When a user's Focus is blocking incoming notifications, their status is automatically displayed to others in Messages, reflecting that a user is not currently reachable.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew Notifications Experience\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNotifications have been redesigned, adding contact photos for people and larger icons for apps that make them even easier to identify. To help reduce distraction, a new notification summary collects non-time-critical notifications for delivery at a more opportune time, such as in the morning and evening. Using on-device intelligence, notifications are arranged by priority, with the most relevant notifications rising to the top, and based on a user's interactions with apps. Urgent messages will be delivered immediately, so important communications will not end up in the summary, and it's easy to temporarily mute any app or messaging thread for the next hour or for the day.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eOn-Device Intelligence Powers Live Text, Advanced Spotlight Search, and More\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nLive Text uses on-device intelligence to recognize text in a photo and allow users to take action. For example, users can search for and locate the picture of a handwritten family recipe, or capture a phone number from a storefront with the option to place a call. With the power of the Apple Neural Engine, the Camera app can also quickly recognize and copy text in the moment, such as the Wi-Fi password displayed at a local coffee shop. With Visual Look Up, users can learn more about popular art and landmarks around the world, plants and flowers found in nature, breeds of pets, and even find books.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSpotlight\u0026#xAE; now uses intelligence to search photos by location, people, scenes, or objects, and using Live Text, Spotlight can find text and handwriting in photos. Spotlight now offers web image search and all-new rich results for actors, musicians, TV shows, and movies. Enhanced results for contacts show recent conversations, shared photos, and even their location if shared through Find My\u0026#x2122;.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nPhotos includes the biggest update ever to Memories, with a fresh new look, an interactive interface, and integration with Apple Music, which uses on-device intelligence to personalize song suggestions that bring memories to life.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eA Redesigned Browsing Experience with Safari\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSafari gets a new design that makes controls easier to reach with one hand and puts content front and center. The new tab bar is compact and lightweight, and floats at the bottom of the screen, so users can easily swipe between tabs. Tab Groups allow users to save tabs and easily access them at any time across iPhone, iPad, or Mac. New features, such as the customizable start page and web extensions on iOS, make Safari even more personal and powerful.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eExplore the World with Apple Maps\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple is committed to building the world's best map, and iOS 15 takes Maps even further with brand new ways to navigate and explore. Users will experience significantly enhanced details in cities for neighborhoods, commercial districts, elevation, and buildings, new road colors and labels, custom-designed landmarks, and a new night-time mode with a moonlit glow. This is a whole new way of looking at the world through Maps.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWhen navigating using iPhone or CarPlay\u0026#xAE;, Maps features a three-dimensional city-driving experience with new road details that help users better see and understand important details like turn lanes, medians, bike lanes, and pedestrian crosswalks.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e4\u003c/sup\u003e Transit riders can find nearby stations more easily and pin favorite lines. Maps automatically follows along with a selected transit route, notifying users when it's nearly time to disembark, and riders can even keep track on Apple Watch\u0026#xAE;. With iOS 15, users can simply hold up iPhone, and Maps generates a highly accurate position to deliver detailed walking directions in augmented reality.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew Keys and State IDs Come to Apple Wallet\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple Wallet\u0026#xAE; adds support for additional types of keys, making it possible to access everyday places with just a tap. Last summer, Apple introduced digital car keys, and BMW was the first car company to add its keys, allowing users to tap to unlock. This year, digital car keys get even better with support for Ultra Wideband technology, so users can securely unlock and start their supported vehicle without removing their iPhone from a pocket or bag.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e5\u003c/sup\u003e iPhone can also be used to unlock a user's home, office, or even a hotel room — all through keys stored in Wallet.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e6\u003c/sup\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nLater this year, customers in participating states in the US will be able to add their driver's license or state IDs to Wallet. The Transportation Security Administration is working to enable airport security checkpoints as the first place customers can use their digital Identity Card in Wallet. Identity Cards in Wallet are encrypted and safely stored in the Secure Element, the same hardware technology that makes Apple Pay\u0026#xAE; private and secure.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew Privacy Features\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niOS 15 introduces even more privacy controls to help protect user information. With on-device speech recognition, audio of Siri requests is now processed entirely on iPhone by default,\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e7\u003c/sup\u003e and performance improves significantly. Mail Privacy Protection stops senders from learning whether an email has been opened, and hides IP addresses so senders can't learn a user's location or use it to build a profile on them. App Privacy Report offers an overview of how apps use the access that has been granted to location, photos, camera, microphone, and contacts in the last seven days, and which other domains are contacted.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e8\u003c/sup\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eRedesigned Weather and Notes Apps\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWeather includes more graphical displays of weather data, full-screen maps, and dynamic layouts that change based on conditions. Beautifully redesigned animated backgrounds more accurately reflect the sun's position and precipitation, and notifications highlight when rain or snow starts and stops.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNotes adds user-created tags that make it easy to quickly categorize notes, and mentions allow members of shared notes to notify one another of important updates. An all-new Activity view shows the recent history of a shared note.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAdditional Features\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSiri\u003c/b\u003e adds Announce Notifications on AirPods\u0026#xAE;, the ability for users to share what's on their screen just by asking, and more.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eShared with You\u003c/b\u003e works across the system to find the articles, music, TV shows, photos, and more that are shared in Messages conversations, and conveniently surfaces them in apps like Photos, Safari, Apple News\u0026#xAE;, Music, Podcasts, and the Apple TV app, making it easy to quickly access the information in context.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eiCloud+\u003c/b\u003e combines everything users love about iCloud\u0026#xAE; with new premium features, including Hide My Email, expanded HomeKit\u0026#xAE; Secure Video support, and an innovative new internet privacy service, iCloud Private Relay, at no additional cost.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e9\u003c/sup\u003e Current iCloud subscribers will be upgraded to iCloud+ automatically this fall. All iCloud+ plans can be shared with people in the same Family Sharing group, so everyone can enjoy the new features, storage, and elevated experience that comes with the service.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eHealth\u003c/b\u003e app gets a new sharing tab that lets users share their health data with family, caregivers, or a care team, Trends gives users a way to focus attention on meaningful changes in personal health metrics, and Walking Steadiness is a new metric that empowers people to proactively manage their fall risk.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eHomeKit\u003c/b\u003e accessory makers can now enable \"Hey Siri\" in their products, allowing customers to talk to and get responses from Siri on third-party devices. \"Hey Siri\"-enabled accessories will relay requests through HomePod\u0026#xAE; or HomePod mini\u0026#x2122; and will support features such as Personal Requests, Intercom, timers, and alarms. Starting today, smart home device manufacturers can begin working with Apple to integrate Siri into their accessories.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFind My\u003c/b\u003e introduces new capabilities to help locate a device that has been turned off or erased, as well as live-streaming locations for family and friends who choose to share their location. Separation Alerts notify a user if they leave an AirTag\u0026#x2122;, Apple device, or Find My network accessory behind in an unfamiliar location, and the Find My network now supports AirPods Pro\u0026#xAE; and AirPods Max\u0026#x2122;. A new Find My widget offers an at-a-glance view directly from the Home Screen.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTranslate\u003c/b\u003e adds a new Live Translate feature that makes conversation flow naturally across languages. Systemwide translation allows users to translate text anywhere on iPhone.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eApple TV\u003c/b\u003e app now features a new row titled \"For All of You\" — showcasing a collection of shows and movies based on the interests of selected people or an entire household — perfect for movie nights.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew iPhone setup\u003c/b\u003e makes it more seamless than ever to get started with iPhone. Existing iPhone users can temporarily back up data to iCloud — even without a subscription — to easily transfer their data to a new iPhone. For those moving to iPhone for the first time, an improved \"Move to iOS\" experience easily transfers photo albums, files, folders, and Accessibility settings, so iPhone feels personal right from the start.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAccessibility\u003c/b\u003e across iPhone expands with new features for VoiceOver that enable users to explore even more details about the people, text, table data, and other objects within images. In support of neurodiversity, new background sounds help minimize distractions, and for those who are deaf or hard of hearing, Made for iPhone supports new bidirectional hearing aids. Sound Actions customizes Switch Control to work with mouth sounds, and users can now customize display and text size on an app-by-app basis. Apple is also bringing support for recognizing imported audiograms — charts that show the results of a hearing test — to Headphone Accommodations.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAvailability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe developer preview of iOS 15 is available to Apple Developer Program members at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.apple.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441048\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005654\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=developer.apple.com\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=ccd338bc8d087a12f8323bdfe7168915\" shape=\"rect\"\u003edeveloper.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e starting today, and a public beta will be available to iOS users next month at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeta.apple.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441048\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005654\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=beta.apple.com\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=29b6345a077cd23caa3a7886e76d2b29\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ebeta.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e. New software features will be available this fall as a free software update for iPhone 6s and later. For more information, visit \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fios%2Fios-15-preview%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441048\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005654\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=apple.com%2Fios%2Fios-15-preview\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=9c07bc9d51db5c5ccef30883e59c3286\" shape=\"rect\"\u003eapple.com/ios/ios-15-preview\u003c/a\u003e. Features are subject to change. Some features may not be available in all regions or all languages.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFootnotes\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1 \u003c/sup\u003eAvailable on iPhone and iPad with A12 Bionic and later and Mac Models (2018 or later).\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2 \u003c/sup\u003eAvailable on iPhone and iPad with A12 Bionic and later and Mac computers with the M1 chip.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e3 \u003c/sup\u003eUsers with non-Apple devices can join using the latest version of Chrome or Edge. Sending video requires H.264 video encoding support.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e4 \u003c/sup\u003eSupport for CarPlay will be available later this year.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e5 \u003c/sup\u003eDigital car keys require a participating car manufacturer and will be coming later this year.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e6 \u003c/sup\u003eSupport for new keys requires an iPhone running iOS 15 and a compatible door lock for apartments, offices, and hotels that will be available through third parties.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e7 \u003c/sup\u003eAvailable on iPhone and iPad with A12 Bionic and later. Requires download of speech models.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e8 \u003c/sup\u003eApp Privacy Report will arrive as part of a software update to iOS 15, iPadOS 15, and watchOS 8.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e9 \u003c/sup\u003eiCloud+ plans: 50GB with one HomeKit Secure Video camera ($0.99 per month), 200GB with up to five HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($2.99 per month), and 2TB with an unlimited number of HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($9.99 per month).\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52441048\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005654\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=4\u0026amp;md5=f604f4363d3553d78ff11971aa3f2303\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, iPhone, FaceTime, SharePlay, Safari, Siri, Apple Music, iPad, Mac, Apple TV, Spotlight, Find My, CarPlay, Apple Watch, Apple Wallet, Apple Pay, AirPods, Apple News, iCloud, HomeKit, HomePod, HomePod mini, AirTag, AirPods Pro, AirPad Max, and the Apple logo are trademarks of Apple. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210607005654r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" style=\"width:0;height:0\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwct31415\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005654/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005654/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21458390","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21458391":{"id":21458391,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:01 -0400","title":"Apple Previews New iPad Productivity Features with iPadOS 15","teaser":"\niPad gets more intuitive multitasking, a new Home Screen design with integrated widgets, the App Library, systemwide note taking with Quick Note, SharePlay, a redesigned Safari experience, and new tools to stay","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niPad gets more intuitive multitasking, a new Home Screen design with integrated widgets, the App Library, systemwide note taking with Quick Note, SharePlay, a redesigned Safari experience, and new tools to stay focused\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today previewed iPadOS\u0026#xAE; 15, with new features that take advantage of the unique capabilities of iPad\u0026#xAE;, helping users be more productive and taking the versatility of iPad even further. iPadOS 15 introduces a multitasking experience that is even more intuitive, making features like Split View and Slide Over easier to discover, easier to use, and more powerful. Notes goes systemwide with Quick Note, and offers new ways to collaborate and organize whether typing or writing with Apple Pencil\u0026#xAE;. New widget layouts for the Home Screen and App Library offer simple ways to personalize the iPad experience and organize apps. Translate delivers new features for translating text and conversations, and users can now build apps for iPhone\u0026#xAE; and iPad, on iPad, with Swift Playgrounds\u0026#xAE;. iPadOS 15 also includes new privacy controls in Siri\u0026#xAE;, Mail, and more places across the system to further protect user information.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005648/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005648/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 480px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210607005648/en/883203/4/Apple_iPadPro-iPadOS15-mail-notes-multitasking-splitview_060721.jpg\" alt=\"iPadOS 15 makes features like Split View and Slide Over easier to discover and use, and more powerful. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003eiPadOS 15 makes features like Split View and Slide Over easier to discover and use, and more powerful. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"We're excited to make the iPad experience even better with iPadOS 15,\" said Craig Federighi, Apple's senior vice president of Software Engineering. \"With more intuitive multitasking, a new Home Screen design with integrated widgets and the App Library, systemwide note taking with Quick Note, Translate designed for iPad, SharePlay, a redesigned Safari experience, new tools to stay focused, and more, users can now be even more productive.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eGet More Done with Multitasking and Keyboard Shortcuts\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niPadOS 15 makes working with multiple apps easier than ever. A new multitasking menu appears at the top of apps, letting users go into Split View or Slide Over with just a tap. Users now have quick access to the Home Screen when using Split View, making it easier to get to the right app. Using the new shelf, they can also multitask with apps that have multiple windows like Safari\u0026#xAE; and Pages\u0026#xAE;, as well as quickly preview emails.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe experience with an external keyboard allows users to get more done with all-new keyboard shortcuts and a redesign of the menu bar. Users can quickly set up and switch between Split View and Slide Over with new shortcuts for multitasking right from the keyboard.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eOrganize and Personalize iPad with Widgets and the App Library\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nUsers can now place widgets among apps on Home Screen pages, providing more information at a glance and offering a more personalized experience. Designed specifically for the larger display of iPad, a new, larger widget size is perfect for showcasing videos, music, games, photos, and more. iPadOS 15 also brings all-new widgets for App Store, Find My\u0026#x2122;, Game Center, Mail, and Contacts.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nAlso coming to iPad is the App Library, automatically organizing apps into helpful categories like Productivity, Games, and Recently Added, and allowing users to access all their apps right from the Dock.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eCapturing Thoughts with Quick Note and Organizing with Tags\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNote taking on iPad gets even better with new features that make it easier to capture and organize thoughts. Notes goes systemwide with Quick Note, a fast and easy way to take notes anywhere across the system. Whether browsing in Safari or finding a restaurant on Yelp, users can bring up Quick Note anywhere to jot down a thought and add links, providing an easy way to get back to exactly what they were looking at.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNotes also has new ways to organize, collaborate, and capture information. Tags make it easy to categorize notes and find them quickly with an all-new Tag Browser and tag-based Smart Folders. For users working with others in shared notes, mentions create a way to notify collaborators and link them back to the note, and a new Activity view shows recent updates in the note.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eMore Natural FaceTime Calls and Shared Experiences with SharePlay\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nFaceTime\u0026#xAE; helps users easily connect with those who matter most, and with iPadOS 15, conversations with friends and family feel even more natural. Users can now share experiences with SharePlay\u0026#x2122; while connecting with friends on FaceTime, including listening to songs together with Apple Music\u0026#xAE;, watching a TV show or movie in sync, or sharing their screen to view apps together. Shared playback controls let anyone play, pause, or jump ahead. Users can extend playback to Apple TV\u0026#xAE;, and watch it on their TV while sharing the moment with friends and family connected over FaceTime. SharePlay also lets users share their screen, perfect for browsing the web together.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eA Redesigned Browsing Experience with Safari\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSafari gets a new tab design that lets users see more of the page as they browse. A new tab bar takes on the color of the webpage and combines tabs, the toolbar, and the search field into a single, compact design. Tab Groups offer a new way to easily save and manage tabs — great for planning trips, shopping, or storing frequently visited tabs. Tab Groups also sync across Mac\u0026#xAE; and iPhone, so users can continue their project from anywhere or easily share them with friends and family. Safari on iPad also now supports web extensions, available from the App Store\u0026#xAE;.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTools to Find Focus\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niPadOS 15 delivers powerful tools that help users focus and reduce distractions. Focus is a new feature that filters notifications based on what a user is doing. Users can set their device to help them be in the moment by creating a custom Focus or selecting a suggested one based on their context, like during their work hours or while they're winding down for bed. Users can also create Home Screen pages with apps and widgets that apply to moments of focus to only display relevant apps and reduce temptation.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nA new notification summary offers an organized collection of notifications that can be delivered any time the user chooses, such as in the morning and evening, making it easy to catch up on the day's activity at their convenience.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eOn-Device Intelligence Powers New Photo Features\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nLive Text uses on-device intelligence to recognize text in a photo and allow users to take action.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e For example, a snapshot of a storefront may reveal a phone number and the option to place a call. With Visual Look Up, users can identify objects within a photo, such as a type of flower or dog breed.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSpotlight\u0026#xAE; now adds the ability to search the Photos app and web images, and has all-new rich results for contacts with context like recent conversations, shared photos, and their location if shared through Find My. Leveraging Live Text, Spotlight makes it easy to look up a photo of a public transit map, receipt, or a screenshot of a cooking recipe. Live Text also works with handwritten text — great for searching photos of whiteboards or notes.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTranslate Comes to iPad with New Ways to Communicate\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe Translate app comes to iPad with new features that make conversations easier and more natural. When using the Translate app, Auto Translate detects when someone is speaking, and in which language, so users can converse naturally without having to tap a microphone button. For even more personal conversations, face-to-face view allows two people to sit across from each other with iPad between them and see translations of the conversation from their own side. Text can now be translated anywhere on iPad by selecting it and tapping Translate, and handwritten text can also be translated. In combination with Live Text, users can even translate text in photos.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eBuild Apps with Swift Playgrounds\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSwift Playgrounds is the best and easiest way to learn how to code. And now with Swift Playgrounds 4,\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2\u003c/sup\u003e users have the tools to build iPhone and iPad apps right on their iPad and submit them directly to the App Store, offering new ways for anyone to create apps and share them with the world.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e3\u003c/sup\u003e Code is immediately reflected in the live preview while building apps, and users can run their apps full screen to test them out. A new open project format based on Swift packages can open and be edited in Swift Playgrounds for iPad as well as within Xcode\u0026#xAE; on Mac, offering users even more versatility to develop apps across iPad and Mac.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAdditional iPadOS 15 Features\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eUniversal Control\u003c/b\u003e lets users work with a single mouse and keyboard to move between iPad and Mac for a seamless experience, with no setup required. Users can even drag and drop content back and forth between devices — great for sketching a drawing with Apple Pencil on iPad and placing it into a Keynote\u0026#xAE; slide on Mac.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eShared with You\u003c/b\u003e works across the system to find the articles, music, TV shows, photos, and more that are shared in Messages conversations, and conveniently surfaces them in apps like Photos, Safari, Apple News\u0026#xAE;, Music, Podcasts, and the Apple TV app, making it easy to quickly access the information in context.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePhotos\u003c/b\u003e includes the biggest update ever to Memories, with a fresh, new look; an immersive, interactive interface; and integration with Apple Music, which uses on-device intelligence to personalize song suggestions that bring memories to life.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eMaps\u003c/b\u003e delivers new ways to navigate and explore the world. Users will experience significantly enhanced details in cities for neighborhoods, commercial districts, elevation, and buildings, new road colors and labels, custom-designed landmarks, and a new night-time mode with a moonlit glow.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePrivacy\u003c/b\u003e is taken to the next level with new protections, transparency features, and controls. Mail Privacy Protection helps stop trackers from snooping on an email, and App Privacy Report provides transparency into how apps are sharing information with other companies.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e4\u003c/sup\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSiri\u003c/b\u003e is designed to protect user privacy. Now, with on-device speech recognition, audio of Siri requests is processed entirely on iPad by default,\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e5 \u003c/sup\u003eand performance improves significantly. Siri also adds Announce Notifications on AirPods\u0026#xAE;, the ability for users to share what's on their screen just by asking, and more.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eiCloud+℠\u003c/b\u003e combines everything users love about iCloud\u0026#xAE; with new premium features, including Hide My Email, expanded HomeKit\u0026#xAE; Secure Video support, and an innovative new internet privacy service, iCloud Private Relay, at no additional cost.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e6 \u003c/sup\u003eCurrent iCloud subscribers will be upgraded to iCloud+ automatically this fall. All iCloud+ plans can be shared with people in the same Family Sharing group, so everyone can enjoy the new features, storage, and elevated experience that comes with the service.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNew \u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eaccessibility\u003c/b\u003e features are designed to work the way users do. The VoiceOver screen reader now uses on-device intelligence to explore objects within images, enabling users to discover more details about the people, text, table data, and other objects within images. Support for third-party eye-tracking hardware enables users to control iPad using only their eyes. Background sounds play continuously and mix into or duck under other audio and system sounds to mask unwanted environmental or external noise, and help users focus, stay calm, or rest. Sound Actions lets users customize Switch Control to work with mouth sounds. Users can now customize display and text size on an app-by-app basis.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAvailability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe developer preview of iPadOS 15 is available to Apple Developer Program members at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.apple.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441045\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005648\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=developer.apple.com\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=b08ea57b111fbd2aa7a0929478a4e69e\" shape=\"rect\"\u003edeveloper.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e starting today, and a public beta will be available to iPadOS users next month at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeta.apple.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441045\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005648\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=beta.apple.com\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=411da0d106410a652ce09eb0f8282277\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ebeta.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e. New software features will be available this fall as a free software update for iPad mini 4 and later, iPad Air 2 and later, iPad 5th generation and later, and all iPad Pro models. For more information, visit \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fapple.com%2Fipados%2Fipados-preview%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441045\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005648\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=apple.com%2Fipados%2Fipados-preview\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=9896f77ee798ac486bd907345ba9d09a\" shape=\"rect\"\u003eapple.com/ipados/ipados-preview\u003c/a\u003e. Features are subject to change. Some features may not be available in all regions or all languages.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFootnotes\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1 \u003c/sup\u003eLive Text: Live camera feature will be coming to iPad in an update later this fall.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2 \u003c/sup\u003eSwift Playgrounds 4 will be available for iPadOS later in the year. The Mac version will be available in early 2022.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e3\u003c/sup\u003e Developer program membership is required.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e4\u003c/sup\u003e App Privacy Report will arrive as part of a software update to iOS 15, iPadOS 15, and watchOS 8.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e5\u003c/sup\u003eAvailable on iPhone and iPad with A12 Bionic and later. Requires download of speech models. Audio is sent to Apple servers if user opts in to improve Siri and Dictation.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e6 \u003c/sup\u003eiCloud+ plans: 50GB with one HomeKit Secure Video camera ($0.99 per month), 200GB with up to five HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($2.99 per month), and 2TB with an unlimited number of HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($9.99 per month).\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52441045\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005648\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=4\u0026amp;md5=feb118aab1271fd4d65ffd4a85c9cf84\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, iPadOS, iPad, Apple Pencil, iPhone, Swift Playgrounds, Siri, Safari, Pages, Find My, FaceTime, SharePlay, Apple Music, Apple TV, Mac, App Store, Spotlight, Xcode, Keynote, Apple News, AirPods, iCloud+, iCloud, HomeKit, and the Apple logo are trademarks of Apple. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210607005648r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" style=\"width:0;height:0\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwct31415\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005648/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005648/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21458391","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21458392":{"id":21458392,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:02 -0400","title":"macOS Monterey Introduces Powerful Features to Get More Done","teaser":"\nMonterey adds new ways to connect with friends and family, work smarter across devices, and stay focused\n\nApple® today previewed macOS® Monterey, the latest version of the world\u0026#39;s most advanced desktop","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nMonterey adds new ways to connect with friends and family, work smarter across devices, and stay focused\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today previewed macOS\u0026#xAE; Monterey, the latest version of the world's most advanced desktop operating system. macOS Monterey comes with new ways for users to connect, get more done, and work more fluidly across their Apple devices. SharePlay\u0026#x2122;, a new feature in FaceTime\u0026#xAE;, lets users share experiences together, and Shared with You makes it easy to discover and enjoy content shared through Messages right in Photos, Safari\u0026#xAE;, Apple Podcasts\u0026#xAE;, Apple News\u0026#xAE;, and the Apple TV\u0026#xAE; app. A major update to Safari features a gorgeous streamlined tab bar and powerful tab organization with Tab Groups, Shortcuts comes to the Mac\u0026#xAE; to automate everyday tasks, and Focus helps users stay on task and reduce distractions. Additionally, Universal Control and AirPlay\u0026#xAE; to Mac are new Continuity features that offer more ways to work effortlessly across Apple devices. macOS Monterey will support the broadest lineup of Macs in history, including the latest iMac\u0026#xAE;, MacBook Air\u0026#xAE;, 13-inch MacBook Pro\u0026#xAE;, and Mac mini\u0026#xAE;, as well as Apple's Intel-based Macs.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005652/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005652/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 480px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210607005652/en/883300/4/Apple_macos-monterey_facetime-messages-safari_06072021.jpg\" alt=\"Unveiled at WWDC21, macOS Monterey gives users the power to accomplish more than ever. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003eUnveiled at WWDC21, macOS Monterey gives users the power to accomplish more than ever. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"macOS Monterey is packed with features that help Mac users get more done, connect with friends and family in amazing new ways, and work across Mac and iPad more seamlessly than ever before,\" said Craig Federighi, Apple's senior vice president of Software Engineering. \"We think our customers are going to love browsing the web with Safari's new tab design, enjoying shared experiences with SharePlay in FaceTime, and using their Mac and other Apple devices together in new ways with Universal Control and AirPlay to Mac.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eGetting More Done with Mac\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNew tools in macOS Monterey are designed to help users get more done, stay focused, and collaborate:\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Already the world's fastest browser, Safari now reimagines the browsing experience with a new tab design that lets users see more of the page as they scroll. A new tab bar takes on the color of the webpage and combines tabs, the tool bar, and the search field into a single compact design. Tab Groups offer a new way to easily save and manage tabs — great for planning trips, shopping, or storing the tabs users visit daily. Tab Groups also sync across Mac\u0026#xAE;, iPhone\u0026#xAE;, and iPad\u0026#xAE;, so users can continue their project from anywhere and easily share tabs with friends and family.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Shortcuts arrives on the Mac to help users automate everyday tasks and achieve peak productivity. Just like on iPhone and iPad, Shortcuts on Mac lets users quickly accomplish tasks with the apps they use the most. With a rich gallery of pre-built actions designed just for Mac, users can instantly share files, make animated GIFs, and more. Power users looking to take things further can use the Shortcuts Editor on Mac to customize shortcuts to match their workflows. Shortcuts is integrated throughout macOS, including the menu bar, Finder\u0026#xAE;, Spotlight\u0026#xAE;, and even hands-free with Siri\u0026#xAE; — making it easy to run shortcuts no matter which app the user is in. Users can easily import existing Automator workflows into Shortcuts and be up and running right away.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— New features in Notes help users stay organized, collaborate, and create notes from anywhere. Quick Note is a new way for users to jot down notes on any app or website systemwide, making it easy to capture thoughts and ideas wherever inspiration strikes. Users can also add links from an app to their Quick Note to create context, even on a website in Safari or an address in Maps. As users work through projects in Notes with friends or colleagues, they can add mentions, see everyone's edits in the new Activity View, and categorize their Notes with tags to quickly and easily find them in the new Tag Browser and in tag-based Smart Folders.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— With Focus, Mac users can stay in the moment by automatically filtering out notifications unrelated to their current activity. Users can signal their status to let others know when they are focusing and not available. When a user has Focus set on one device, it automatically sets across their other devices and can be customized based on their current activity — whether they are preparing for a presentation or wrapping up an assignment for school.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAll New Ways to Stay Connected\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nmacOS Monterey provides meaningful new ways to connect and enjoy time with friends, family, and colleagues:\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— FaceTime now includes a suite of new audio and video features that make calls feel more natural and lifelike. With spatial audio, voices in a FaceTime call sound like they are coming from where the person is positioned on the screen, while Voice Isolation ensures the user's voice is crystal clear and uses machine learning to eliminate background noise, and Wide Spectrum allows all the sound in the area to come through so participants can hear everything. Portrait mode taps into the Apple Neural Engine in the M1 chip to blur the user's background for a stunning video effect, and a new Grid View shows participants in same-sized tiles.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— SharePlay is a powerful set of system features that enables users to have shared experiences while on a FaceTime call. Users can share their favorite music, TV shows, movies, projects, and more with friends and family in real time — kicking off a shared listening party, watching movies and shows, collaborating in apps through screen sharing, and more. With an API built for easy adoption, third-party developers can bring their own apps right into FaceTime.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Shared with You makes it easy to locate and enjoy all the great content that's shared through Messages, including photos, videos, articles, and more, right from a Shared with You tab within Photos, Safari, Apple Podcasts, Apple News, and the Apple TV app.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew Ways to Work Across Apple Devices\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWorking across Apple devices is now better than ever with new Continuity features:\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Universal Control lets users work with a single mouse and keyboard and move between Mac and iPad for a seamless experience, with no setup required. Users can even drag and drop content back and forth between devices — great for sketching a drawing with Apple Pencil\u0026#xAE; on iPad and placing it into a Keynote\u0026#xAE; slide on the Mac.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— With AirPlay to Mac, users can play, present, and share just about anything — from the latest movies and games to vacation photos and presentations — from their iPhone or iPad right to their Mac's stunning Retina\u0026#xAE; display. The Mac's high-fidelity sound system can also be used as an AirPlay speaker, so users can play music or podcasts on their Mac, or use their Mac as a secondary speaker for multiroom audio.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAdditional New Features of macOS Monterey\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith the new interactive globe in Maps and an amazing, immersive, and detailed city experience, users can enjoy new ways to navigate and explore the natural beauty of the Earth on the Mac's large, gorgeous display.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nLive Text uses on-device machine learning to detect text in photos, including phone numbers, websites, addresses, and tracking numbers, so users can copy and paste, make a phone call, open a website, and easily find more information. Visual Lookup also uses machine learning to help users discover and learn about animals, art, landmarks, plants, and more in photos. These features work across macOS, including in apps like Photos, Messages, and Safari.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niCloud+℠ combines everything users love about iCloud\u0026#xAE; with new premium features, including Hide My Email, expanded HomeKit\u0026#xAE; Secure Video support, and an innovative new internet privacy service, iCloud Private Relay, at no additional cost.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e All iCloud+ plans can be shared with people in the same Family Sharing group, so everyone can enjoy the new features, storage, and elevated experience that comes with the service.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nAirPods Pro\u0026#xAE; and AirPods Max\u0026#x2122; deliver a theater-like experience with spatial audio on Macs with the M1 chip.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nPrivacy features like Mail Privacy Protection let users choose whether emails can collect information about their Mail activity, and the Mac recording indicator now shows which app is accessing the Mac's microphone.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNew accessibility features let anyone add alternative image descriptions right from Markup, and improved Full Keyboard Access and new cursor customization options provide more flexibility when navigating Mac.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAvailability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe developer beta of macOS Monterey is available to Apple Developer Program members at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.apple.com\u0026amp;esheet=52441275\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005652\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=developer.apple.com\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=fdf6a59f4ce8b6b535fd8fcd4e15bcf4\" shape=\"rect\"\u003edeveloper.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e starting today. A public beta will be available to Mac users next month at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeta.apple.com\u0026amp;esheet=52441275\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005652\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=beta.apple.com\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=0d7c54cbfa7cabb3967dcfcf31746156\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ebeta.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e. macOS Monterey will be available this fall as a free software update. For more information, including compatible Mac models, visit \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fapple.com%2Fmacos%2Fmonterey-preview\u0026amp;esheet=52441275\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005652\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=apple.com%2Fmacos%2Fmonterey-preview\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=09ed027e134d429b3e7294a2f27478ab\" shape=\"rect\"\u003eapple.com/macos/monterey-preview\u003c/a\u003e. Features are subject to change. Some features may not be available in all regions or languages.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1 \u003c/sup\u003eiCloud+ plans: 50GB with one HomeKit Secure Video camera ($0.99/mo), 200GB with up to five HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($2.99/mo), and 2TB with an unlimited number of HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($9.99/mo). Current iCloud storage subscribers will be upgraded to iCloud+ automatically this fall.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52441275\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005652\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=4\u0026amp;md5=3444401b9ada4c61677ff06f8872786d\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, the Apple logo, macOS, SharePlay, FaceTime, Safari, Apple Podcasts, Apple News, Apple TV, Mac AirPlay, iMac, MacBook Air, MacBook Pro, Mac mini, Mac, iPhone, iPad, Finder, Spotlight, Siri, Apple Pencil, Keynote, Retina, iCloud+, iCloud, HomeKit, AirPods Pro, and AirPods Max are trademarks of Apple. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210607005652r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" style=\"width:0;height:0\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwct31415\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005652/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005652/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21458392","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21458393":{"id":21458393,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:02 -0400","title":"watchOS 8 Brings New Access, Connectivity, and Mindfulness Features to Apple Watch","teaser":"\nNew watchOS offers greater access with Wallet, more capabilities with the Home app, new workout types, and an updated Breathe app\n\nApple® today previewed watchOS® 8, with impactful new features that make the","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew watchOS offers greater access with Wallet, more capabilities with the Home app, new workout types, and an updated Breathe app\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today previewed watchOS\u0026#xAE; 8, with impactful new features that make the world's most advanced wearable operating system even more essential for users to stay healthy, active, and connected. Updates to the Wallet and Home apps extend Apple Watch\u0026#xAE; as an increasingly useful tool for convenient access across the car and places users live, work, and visit. A reimagined Breathe app and new Tai Chi and Pilates workout types help users lead a fit and healthy life and support mental well-being, while a new Portraits watch face and enhancements to Messages and the Photos app make staying connected to loved ones even easier.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005659/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005659/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 480px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210607005659/en/883235/4/apple_wwdc21-watchos8_hero_06072021.jpg\" alt=\"watchOS 8 brings new access, connectivity, and mindfulness features to Apple Watch this fall. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003ewatchOS 8 brings new access, connectivity, and mindfulness features to Apple Watch this fall. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"Apple Watch is the most loved watch in the world, keeping users healthy, active, and connected,\" said Kevin Lynch, Apple's vice president of Technology. \"With watchOS 8, we're bringing more convenient access to places users live, work, and visit with significant updates to Home and Wallet, expanding support for both physical and mental well-being, and enabling richer personal connections with the new Portraits face and updates to Messages.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eMore Access with Wallet\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith Apple Watch, it is incredibly convenient to use Apple Pay\u0026#xAE; and Wallet to make secure, contactless payments in stores or ride transit. With watchOS 8, Wallet brings even more powerful contact-free ways for users to access the places and things they care about seamlessly, safely, and securely.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nFirst announced at WWDC in 2020, Ultra Wideband support now arrives for digital car keys on Apple Watch Series 6. Apple Watch wearers can securely unlock their car from a distance and start it from the driver's seat.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e This fall, users can also add keys for their home, office, and hotel to Wallet, and tap their Apple Watch to unlock.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2\u003c/sup\u003e Later this year, beginning with participating states in the US, users will be able to add their driver's license or state ID to Wallet. Select TSA checkpoints will be the first place users can begin using their digital ID.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eRedesigned Home App\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe redesigned Home app in watchOS 8 offers more convenient access to accessories and scenes needed in a particular moment, and the ability to control accessories by room. Users with a HomeKit\u0026#xAE;-enabled camera can view who is at the door directly on their wrist. Apple Watch users can also tap Intercom to quickly broadcast a message throughout the home or to individual rooms via HomePod\u0026#xAE;, HomePod mini\u0026#x2122;, or other personal devices.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew Workout Types\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nwatchOS 8 introduces two new popular workout types that are beneficial for both physical fitness and mindful movement: Tai Chi and Pilates. These new workout types are supported by powerful, validated custom-built heart rate and motion algorithms to provide users with accurate metrics.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eA New Approach to Mindfulness\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNow more than ever, people are recognizing the importance of finding small moments in their day to be more mindful. In watchOS 8, the Breathe app becomes the Mindfulness app, featuring an enhanced Breathe experience, plus a new session type, Reflect. Reflect offers a mindful intention to focus on for as little as one minute that can be done anywhere and at any time. Each Reflect session welcomes the user with a unique, thoughtful notion to consider that invites a positive frame of mind. For example, the user may see something like \"Recall a time recently when you felt a sense of calm. Bring that feeling into this moment,\" or \"Reflect on one thing you're grateful for and think about why you appreciate it so much.\" Both the Breathe and Reflect experiences also offer tips to help users get more from each session and feature beautiful new animations.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSleeping Respiratory Rate\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nToday, Apple Watch helps users meet their sleep goals by establishing a pre-bedtime routine, and tracks metrics like time asleep, heart rate, and blood oxygen. watchOS 8 gives users even more insight into their overall wellness by tracking sleeping respiratory rate, which is the number of breaths per minute. To do this, Apple Watch uses the built-in accelerometer to measure respiratory rate while sleeping, and this information can be viewed, along with trends over time, in the Health app on iPhone\u0026#xAE;.
