This metric is also available for developers to use with permission through HealthKit\u0026#xAE;.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePortraits Watch Face and Photos\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe Photos face is the most popular Apple Watch face, and watchOS 8 introduces new ways to view and engage with users' favorite photos right from their wrist. The new Portraits watch face brings to life stunning portrait photos shot on iPhone with an immersive, multilayered effect, intelligently recognizing faces in photos and cropping in to highlight the subject. The Photos app is also redesigned, offering new ways to view and navigate collections, Memories and Featured Photos now sync to Apple Watch, and photos can be shared through Messages and Mail with the new Share Sheet.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eMessages and Contacts\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nCommunicating on Apple Watch is even easier with new tools in Messages. Users can combine the use of Scribble, dictation, and emoji all within the same message, and for dictated messages, they have the option to edit the presented text. To easily add even more expression to a message, users can simply enter a word or phrase and select from hundreds of trending GIFs.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nwatchOS 8 also brings the Contacts app to Apple Watch, providing a simple way for users to browse, add, and edit contacts, and share contacts directly from the app.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFocus\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nwatchOS 8 supports Focus, a powerful set of tools available in iOS 15 to help users reduce distraction and be in the moment. Apple Watch will automatically align with any Focus set on iOS, so that notifications from people and apps are filtered based on what a user is currently doing. Focus uses on-device intelligence to make suggestions based on usage patterns — for example, when starting a workout on Apple Watch, the Focus for fitness is suggested.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAdditional watchOS 8 Updates\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nMultiple timers come to Apple Watch and can be given a specific label using Siri\u0026#xAE; (such as \"Laundry Timer\" or \"Cooking Timer\").\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nIn watchOS 8, more Apple Watch apps support the Always-On display, including Maps, Mindfulness, Now Playing, Phone, Podcasts, Stopwatch, Timers, Voice Memos, and others. watchOS 8 is also making it easier for developers to keep their apps timely and relevant with a new Always-On API for third-party apps.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nTo support Apple Watch users with upper-body limb differences, AssistiveTouch\u0026#xAE; enables one-arm usage of Apple Watch by sensing simple hand gestures to interact without touching the display. Using the built-in motion sensors, users can answer incoming calls, control an onscreen motion pointer, and surface an action menu that can access Notification Center, Control Center, and more.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nA new Find Items app on Apple Watch helps users locate tagged items using the Find My\u0026#x2122; network, and a new Find Devices app helps users locate lost Apple devices that are signed in with the same Apple ID.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe redesigned Music app\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/b\u003eenables users to share songs, albums, and playlists through Messages and Mail, and enjoy music and radio all in one place.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe Weather app now supports Severe Weather notifications, displaying government alerts about certain severe weather events. The app also delivers Next Hour precipitation alerts\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/b\u003eand offers updated complications.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nFamily Setup introduces the ability to add transit cards from Hong Kong, Japan, and select China mainland and US cities, and Calendar and Mail now include the option to add a Google account.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple Fitness+℠, the first fitness service created entirely around Apple Watch, expands its offering in watchOS 8 with Picture in Picture support and new filtering options, and users can stop and resume an in-progress workout on any device. Later this month, Fitness+ introduces a new series of workouts featuring Jeanette Jenkins, one of the most sought-after fitness experts, and a new Artist Spotlight Series with workouts featuring entire playlists from Lady Gaga, Jennifer Lopez, Keith Urban, and Alicia Keys.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePrivacy\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple believes privacy is a fundamental human right. Since privacy is particularly important for Health and identification, Health data is encrypted on device or in iCloud\u0026#xAE; with iCloud sync. For identification, Identity Cards in Wallet are encrypted and securely stored in the Secure Element, the same hardware technology used to keep Apple Pay private and secure. Apple cannot see when or where digital IDs are presented when using a driver's license or state ID.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAvailability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe developer beta of watchOS 8 is available to Apple Developer Program members at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.apple.com\u0026amp;esheet=52441149\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005659\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=developer.apple.com\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=7ab4926eb509a5957f6c052aa1ec9f92\" shape=\"rect\"\u003edeveloper.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e starting today. A public beta will be available to watchOS users next month at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeta.apple.com\u0026amp;esheet=52441149\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005659\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=beta.apple.com\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=6e30d17fa9745409bb390d7d5338b7e5\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ebeta.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e. watchOS 8 will be available this fall as a free software update for Apple Watch Series 3 or later paired with iPhone 6s or later, running iOS 15. Some features may not be available in all regions or all languages, or on all devices. Features are subject to change. For more information, visit \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fapple.com%2FwatchOS%2FwatchOS-preview\u0026amp;esheet=52441149\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005659\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=apple.com%2Fwatchos%2Fwatchos-preview\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=66eed7c10674673fd500977ce883e83d\" shape=\"rect\"\u003eapple.com/watchos/watchos-preview\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFootnotes\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1 \u003c/sup\u003eDigital car keys require a participating car manufacturer and will be coming later this year.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2\u003c/sup\u003e Support for new keys in Apple Wallet\u0026#xAE; requires a compatible door lock for homes, offices, and hotels that will be available through third parties.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52441149\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005659\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=4\u0026amp;md5=f03f4cde20e582b51a441cbcdeb64fe1\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, the Apple logo, watchOS, Apple Watch, Apple Pay, HomeKit, HomePod, HomePod mini, iPhone, HealthKit, Siri, AssistiveTouch, Find My, Apple Fitness+, iCloud, and Apple Wallet are trademarks of Apple. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210607005659r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" style=\"width:0;height:0\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwct31415\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005659/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005659/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21458393","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21458394":{"id":21458394,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:03 -0400","title":"Apple Introduces New Developer Tools and Technologies to Create Even Better Apps","teaser":"\nXcode Cloud will help developers build apps even faster, and new App Store features enable developers to reach more users\n\nApple® today unveiled new tools and technologies designed to help developers create more","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nXcode Cloud will help developers build apps even faster, and new App Store features enable developers to reach more users\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today unveiled new tools and technologies designed to help developers create more engaging app experiences and make it even easier to build high-quality apps. Xcode\u0026#xAE; Cloud brings together the multiple tasks and tools required to build, test, and deliver apps using powerful cloud services, enabling individual developers and teams to be more productive and provide great apps to their users. With In-App Events and Custom Product Pages, the App Store\u0026#xAE; now provides all-new ways for developers to promote their apps and connect with users. Swift\u0026#xAE; takes a massive leap forward with concurrency support built into the language, and new augmented reality (AR) technologies make it easier than ever to build immersive content in apps or on the web.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005649/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005649/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 480px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210607005649/en/883336/4/Apple_MacBookPro-Xcode-DarkMode_060721.jpg\" alt=\"New tools designed expressly for Apple developers will help create even more engaging app experiences. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003eNew tools designed expressly for Apple developers will help create even more engaging app experiences. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"We're thrilled to provide our developer community with powerful new tools and technologies to help create even more compelling and higher-quality apps, while engaging with their users in all new ways through the App Store,\" said Susan Prescott, Apple's vice president of Worldwide Developer Relations. \"With the robust set of tools included in Xcode Cloud, continuing innovation in the Swift programming language, a wide range of new APIs, and even more ways to reach users — Apple's platforms have never been stronger.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eXcode Cloud\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nXcode Cloud is a new continuous integration and delivery cloud service designed specifically for Apple developers. Built into Xcode 13, Xcode Cloud offers a fast and simple way for developers and teams of all sizes to build, test, and deliver high-quality apps even more efficiently. Xcode Cloud can automatically build apps in the cloud to free up developers' Macs for other tasks. Parallel testing in the cloud means developers can test on a simulated version of every current Apple device, then easily deploy a build of the app for internal testing, or deliver to external beta testers through TestFlight\u0026#xAE; for instant feedback.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eApp Store\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith more apps and games featuring events like live competitions, movie premieres, live-streamed experiences, and much more, it's now easier for users to discover these events right on the App Store — in personalized recommendations, editorial selections, search results, and on app product pages. This greatly expands the reach of developers' events — helping connect them with new users, keep their current users informed, or reconnect them with past users. It's a whole new way for developers to showcase what's happening in their apps.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nA top-requested feature among developers, Apple is introducing new product page tools that offer developers greater flexibility and new ways to connect with users right in the App Store. Custom Product Pages let developers showcase different features of their app for different users, while Product Page Optimization gives developers the ability to test different screenshots, preview videos, and even app icons. With rich, privacy-friendly analytics in App Store Connect, developers can see what their users like most and make the best decisions for their product pages.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple is introducing updated guidelines that include support for the emerging category of apps that offer creator content experiences. The developer code of conduct expands to help keep the App Store a fair marketplace for developers and users, including updated guidelines around developer identity requirements, ratings and review manipulation, and excessive customer complaints. There are also new avenues for developers to appeal an app rejection on concerns of bias, as well as the option for them to report an app if there is reason to believe an app presents a trust or safety concern, or is in violation of the App Store Review Guidelines.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eSwift\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSwift — Apple's powerful and intuitive programming language — now features built-in concurrency support. This means developers can more easily write code that does work in parallel, which is key to building apps that are responsive to user input, while doing more work in the background. With concurrency in Swift, developers can write fast, modern, safe code with fewer mistakes, and take full advantage of the powerful multicore silicon across Apple's devices.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSwiftUI\u0026#xAE; has reinvented user interface development by making it easier to develop great-looking apps with as little code as possible. Now SwiftUI takes a huge step forward, helping developers bring better experiences to all their users. This includes enhancements for improving list views, search experiences, in-app accessibility features, multi-column tables, and so much more.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nSwift Playgrounds\u0026#xAE; is a great way to learn to code right on a Mac\u0026#xAE; or iPad\u0026#xAE;. With Swift Playgrounds 4, coming later this year, users will be able to create the visual design of an app with SwiftUI. App projects can be opened and edited in Swift Playgrounds or in Xcode, and when they're ready, users can build a real app and submit it directly to the App Store right from their iPad.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAugmented Reality\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple has the world's largest augmented reality platform with over 1 billion AR-enabled devices powered by ARKit\u0026#xAE;, a framework that allows developers to easily create AR experiences, and RealityKit\u0026#x2122;, the rendering, animation, audio, and physics engine built from the ground up for AR.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nRealityKit 2 introduces Object Capture, a simple and powerful API on macOS Monterey\u0026#x2122; that enables developers — like Wayfair, Etsy, and more — to create high-quality, photo-realistic 3D models of real-world objects in minutes by taking photos shot on iPhone\u0026#xAE;, iPad, or DSLR and transforming them into 3D models optimized for AR. These models can be viewed in AR Quick Look or added to AR scenes in Reality Composer\u0026#x2122; or Xcode, making it easier than ever to build amazing AR apps. Developers like Maxon and Unity are using Object Capture to unlock entirely new ways of creating 3D content within some of the leading 3D content creation apps, such as Cinema4D and Unity MARS.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith new APIs in RealityKit 2, developers can also create more realistic and complex AR experiences with greater visual, audio, and animation control, including custom render passes and dynamic shaders.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eGraphics and Games\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNew APIs and tools in iOS, iPadOS\u0026#xAE;, and macOS\u0026#xAE; will help game developers create the next generation of games and deliver all-new experiences to their users. A new Metal\u0026#xAE; texture compression tool supports all of the latest formats, as well as optimized formats for Apple silicon, making it easier for developers to bring high-end games to all of Apple's platforms. Additionally, a new Virtual Game Controller on iPhone and iPad provides an easy method to optimize games that build in Game Controller support.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAdditional Developer Tools and APIs\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple is providing developers with a range of new tools and APIs that will push their app experience forward and enable them to create entirely new features — all built with privacy at the forefront.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Xcode 13 adds powerful new team development features that are perfect for working with Xcode Cloud, as well as with GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab collaboration features.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— With SharePlay\u0026#x2122;, popular apps like Disney+, ESPN+, HBO Max, Hulu, MasterClass, Paramount+, TikTok, and Twitch are building new types of shared experiences for users on iPhone, iPad, and Mac.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Third-party video-calling apps can take advantage of the latest FaceTime\u0026#xAE; enhancements, including Voice Isolation, Wide Spectrum Audio, and Portrait mode.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Messaging apps including Slack and WeChat can now share user status in conversations; apps like Uber Eats can have Siri announce incoming messages; and new Notification APIs enable high-priority and communication notifications from apps like Chase Mobile and Zomato to break through Do Not Disturb or a Focus.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— New camera APIs allow for better fused images and add the ability to capture high-quality stills and 1080p video in the same session.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Apple Watch\u0026#xAE; developers like Breakpoint Studio, Pandora, Qardio, and more are now creating new app experiences that offer a deeper level of customization, and are more responsive to their users' environment.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— With TestFlight on the Mac, developers can test in-app purchases and other great Mac app features.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— StoreKit\u0026#x2122; 2, which ensures in-app purchases are safe and secure for customers, now features new APIs for handling product entitlements and subscriber status, and testing support in both Xcode and the Apple sandbox environment.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Web developers including Grammarly and Honey are now building extensions in Safari that are available across iPhone, iPad, and Mac. Developers can even create new, powerful extensions in the Mail app.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Third-party navigation apps can now show a map view in a vehicle's instrument cluster display, and a new CarPlay\u0026#xAE; simulator for Mac vastly improves testing efficiency.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— Apps can offer the theater-like experience of spatial audio and place sounds all around to bring their content to life. And Physical Audio Spatialization Engine (PHASE) makes it easy for game developers to render true-to-life audio across all of Apple's platforms.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n— ShazamKit\u0026#x2122; enables developers to integrate audio recognition technology directly from Shazam\u0026#xAE; into their apps, making it possible not only to match music to Shazam\u0026#39;s vast catalog of songs, but also to match any prerecorded audio to custom results developers create.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAvailability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nDeveloper betas for iOS 15, iPadOS 15, macOS Monterey, watchOS\u0026#xAE; 8, and tvOS\u0026#xAE; 15 are available to Apple Developer Program members at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.apple.com\u0026amp;esheet=52441393\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005649\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=developer.apple.com\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=80e191754da711c096fc3398878b8334\" shape=\"rect\"\u003edeveloper.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e starting today. Xcode Cloud will be available as a limited free beta starting today, with expanding access throughout this summer and fall, and will be available to all developers next year. More details on pricing and availability for Xcode Cloud will be shared this fall.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1 \u003c/sup\u003eSome shared content may require a subscription to view.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52441393\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005649\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=7382727a45600cc3cea643f25114f31e\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, the Apple logo, Xcode, App Store, Swift, TestFlight, SwiftUI, Swift Playgrounds, Mac, iPad, ARKit, RealityKit, macOS Monterey, Reality Composer, iPhone, iPadOS, macOS, Metal, SharePlay, FaceTime, Apple Watch, StoreKit, CarPlay, ShazamKit, Shazam, watchOS, and tvOS are trademarks of Apple. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210607005649r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" style=\"width:0;height:0\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwct31415\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005649/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005649/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21458394","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21458395":{"id":21458395,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:03 -0400","title":"Apple Advances Its Privacy Leadership with iOS 15, iPadOS 15, macOS Monterey, and watchOS 8","teaser":"\nNew features help users control and monitor apps\u0026#39; use of their data\n\nApple® today previewed powerful new privacy protections in iOS 15, iPadOS® 15, macOS® Monterey, and watchOS® 8, which help users","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eNew features help users control and monitor apps' use of their data\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today previewed powerful new privacy protections in iOS 15, iPadOS\u0026#xAE; 15, macOS\u0026#xAE; Monterey, and watchOS\u0026#xAE; 8, which help users better control and manage access to their data. These features represent the latest innovations in Apple's legacy of privacy leadership, as the company has continually expanded its commitment to privacy and encouraged change across the industry with features like App Tracking Transparency and Privacy Nutrition Labels on the App Store\u0026#xAE;.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005653/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005653/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 378px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210607005653/en/883280/4/Apple_iPhone12Pro-Safari-Privacy-Report_060721.jpg\" alt=\"Safari Privacy Report shows you all the cross-site trackers that are being blocked by Intelligent Tracking Prevention in Safari. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003eSafari Privacy Report shows you all the cross-site trackers that are being blocked by Intelligent Tracking Prevention in Safari. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"Privacy has been central to our work at Apple from the very beginning,\" said Craig Federighi, Apple's senior vice president of Software Engineering. \"Every year, we push ourselves to develop new technology to help users take more control of their data and make informed decisions about whom they share it with. This year's updates include innovative features that give users deeper insights and more granular control than ever before.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eProtect Data from Third Parties\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nIn the Mail app, Mail Privacy Protection stops senders from using invisible pixels to collect information about the user. The new feature helps users prevent senders from knowing when they open an email, and masks their IP address so it can't be linked to other online activity or used to determine their location.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nFor a number of years, Intelligent Tracking Prevention has helped protect Safari\u0026#xAE; users from unwanted tracking by using on-device machine learning to stop trackers while allowing websites to function normally. This year, Intelligent Tracking Prevention is getting even stronger by also hiding the user's IP address from trackers. This means they can't utilize the user's IP address as a unique identifier to connect their activity across websites and build a profile about them.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eCheck Up on App Privacy\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith App Privacy Report, users can see how often each app has used the permission they've previously granted to access their location, photos, camera, microphone, and contacts during the past seven days.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e Users can check whether this makes sense to them, and take action by going to the app in Settings if it doesn't. Users can also find out with whom their data may be shared by seeing all the third-party domains an app is contacting.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eProcess Audio of Siri Requests on Device\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith on-device speech recognition, the audio of users' requests is processed right on their iPhone\u0026#xAE; or iPad\u0026#xAE; by default. This addresses one of the biggest privacy concerns for voice assistants, which is unwanted audio recording. For many requests, Siri\u0026#xAE; processing is also moving on device, enabling requests to be processed without an internet connection, such as launching apps, setting timers and alarms, changing settings, or controlling music.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eEnhance Internet Privacy with iCloud+\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niCloud+℠ combines everything customers love about iCloud\u0026#xAE; with new premium features, including iCloud Private Relay, Hide My Email, and expanded HomeKit\u0026#xAE; Secure Video support, at no additional cost.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2\u003c/sup\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nPrivate Relay is a new internet privacy service that's built right into iCloud, allowing users to connect to and browse the web in a more secure and private way. When browsing with Safari, Private Relay ensures all traffic leaving a user's device is encrypted, so no one between the user and the website they are visiting can access and read it, not even Apple or the user's network provider. All the user's requests are then sent through two separate internet relays. The first assigns the user an anonymous IP address that maps to their region but not their actual location. The second decrypts the web address they want to visit and forwards them to their destination. This separation of information protects the user's privacy because no single entity can identify both who a user is and which sites they visit.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nExpanding on the capabilities of Sign in with Apple, Hide My Email lets users share unique, random email addresses that forward to their personal inbox anytime they wish to keep their personal email address private. Built directly into Safari, iCloud settings, and Mail, Hide My Email also enables users to create and delete as many addresses as needed at any time, helping give users control of who is able to contact them.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e3\u003c/sup\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\niCloud+ expands built-in support for HomeKit Secure Video, so users can connect more cameras than ever before in the Home app, while giving them end-to-end encrypted storage for home security video footage that will not count against their storage capacity. HomeKit Secure Video also ensures that activity detected by users' security cameras is analyzed and encrypted by their Apple devices at home before being securely stored in iCloud.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAdditional Features for Users and Developers\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThese releases also feature powerful new tools that help developers enhance app functionality while preserving user privacy.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith share current location, users can easily share their current location with an app just once, without giving the developer further access after that session. Developers can customize the share current location button, and integrate it directly into their apps.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith enhanced Photos limited library access, developers can offer smart functionality — like a recent photos folder for specific albums — even when a user has only granted limited access.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith secure paste, developers can let users paste from a different app without having access to what was copied until the user takes action to paste it into their app. When developers use secure paste, users will be able to paste without being alerted via the pasteboard transparency notification, helping give them peace of mind.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFootnotes\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e App Privacy Report will arrive as part of a software update to iOS 15, iPadOS 15, and watchOS 8.\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e2\u003c/sup\u003e iCloud+ plans: 50GB with one HomeKit Secure Video camera ($0.99 per month), 200GB with up to five HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($2.99 per month), and 2TB with an unlimited number of HomeKit Secure Video cameras ($9.99 per month).\n\u003cbr xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003c/br\u003e\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e3\u003c/sup\u003e Hide My Email will arrive in Mail as part of a software update to iOS 15, iPadOS 15, macOS Monterey, and iCloud.com.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52441164\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005653\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=a36fee210db9fb41575a8c2270c5fb8d\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, the Apple logo, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, App Store, Safari, iPhone, iPad, Siri, iCloud+, iCloud, and HomeKit are trademarks of Apple. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210607005653r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" style=\"width:0;height:0\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwct31415\"\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005653/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005653/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21458395","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21458396":{"id":21458396,"author":"Business Wire","created":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:00 -0400","updated":"Mon, 07 Jun 2021 14:45:04 -0400","title":"Apple Advances Personal Health by Introducing Secure Sharing and New Insights","teaser":"\nWith iOS 15, iPhone and Apple Watch users now have the ability to share health data with loved ones or a care network, view Trends, and measure their Walking Steadiness\n\nApple® today previewed advanced consumer","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eWith iOS 15, iPhone and Apple Watch users now have the ability to share health data with loved ones or a care network, view Trends, and measure their Walking Steadiness\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple\u0026#xAE; today previewed advanced consumer health and wellness insights for users, as well as new tools for supporting loved ones. Building on the current innovative health features of iPhone\u0026#xAE; and Apple Watch\u0026#xAE;, iOS 15 gives users the ability to securely share their data with important people in their life, like a family member or physician, and receive insights into the health trends of their loved ones. Additionally, new tools in iOS 15 can be used to identify, measure, and understand changes in a person's health data.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"news-body-cta\"\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here: \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005660/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005660/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"bwbodyimg\" style=\"width: 480px; float:left; padding-left:0px; padding-right:20px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px;\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mms.businesswire.com/media/20210607005660/en/883238/4/Apple_wwdc21-ios15-health-app_hero_06072021.jpg\" alt=\"iOS 15 brings secure sharing and new insights for users within the Health app. (Photo: Business Wire)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" style=\"font-size:85%;\"\u003eiOS 15 brings secure sharing and new insights for users within the Health app. (Photo: Business Wire)\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\"This past year has emphasized the importance of health, and we're enabling our users to take a more active role in their well-being. We've added powerful features that give users the most comprehensive set of insights to better understand their health trends over time,\" said Jeff Williams, Apple's chief operating officer. \"Many people around the world are caring for someone, and we want to provide a secure and private way for users to have a trusted partner on their health journey. We're excited to bring these innovative tools directly into users' hands.\"\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eHealth Sharing\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith iOS 15, users can choose to securely give a loved one visibility into their health and wellness data, enabling them to have more meaningful conversations and provide support — even from afar — as they follow important alerts and changes over time.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nIn the Health app, a new Sharing tab lets users privately share their data with a trusted partner or caregiver. Users have full control over which data they share and with whom, whether they're an aging parent who shares their activity or heart health data with a family member, a partner who chooses to share their fertility window insights, or a person with Parkinson's disease who wants to share their mobility data with a physical therapist. For the person receiving this information, shared data is presented with important insights and trends highlighted.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nHaving meaningful conversations with a doctor about everyday activities during a visit is a key part of managing health, but it can be difficult to remember the details. With user permission, the Health app can keep track of valuable information, helping bridge the gap of what a person experiences between clinic appointments. Now, users in the US can choose to share certain types of health data — like heart rate, detected falls, hours of sleep, or exercise minutes — with their doctor, for more informed conversations. At participating healthcare organizations, a physician can review the Apple Health app data that a user chooses to share directly in the electronic health records system.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eTrends\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe Health app adds trend analysis for 20 types of data — ranging from resting heart rate to sleep to cardio fitness — so users can easily see how a given metric is progressing. A critical part of maintaining\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/b\u003epersonal\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e \u003c/b\u003ewellness is tracking changes in health, which can be subtle and easy to miss. For users looking to keep an eye on their data over time, Trends is a new way to intelligently and proactively highlight important changes, and surfaces the information in a way that's easy to understand.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nUsers can also keep tabs on goals, like increasing running distance or mindful minutes. For those looking to monitor insights across areas like insulin delivery, trend analysis applies to data from third-party devices connected to the Health app.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith optional notifications, Trends can highlight long-term changes in health, so a user can celebrate progress toward a goal, or discuss with a doctor or care team.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eWalking Steadiness\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nMore than 37 million people each year require medical attention as a result of a fall, which can often be a tipping point for more serious conditions and a loss of independence.\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1\u003c/sup\u003e Walking Steadiness on iPhone is an industry first, providing insight into fall risk by capturing important mobility data as users walk with their iPhone. Currently, fall risk is assessed by a care provider through a questionnaire and an in-person evaluation. Walking Steadiness offers the added ability to capture everyday movements and surface classifications within the Health app as OK, Low, or Very Low, allowing users to proactively take action to help reduce their risk of falling.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWalking Steadiness uses custom algorithms to assess balance, stability, and coordination through built-in motion sensors on iPhone. This first-of-its-kind metric was established using real-world data from the Apple Heart and Movement Study, with more than 100,000 participants across all ages — the largest data set ever used to study fall risk.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nIn addition to alerting users of possible fall risk, Walking Steadiness helps users meet their stability goals. Users can choose to receive a notification when their score is Low or Very Low, and be directed to curated visual exercises that are based on clinically validated methods to increase strength and balance.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003ePrivacy \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nPrivacy is fundamental in the design and development across all of Apple's health features. Health data is under a user's control, with granular control over which data types they choose to share and with whom. Data is encrypted when in transit and while at rest on a user's device when locked behind a passcode, Face ID\u0026#xAE;, or Touch ID\u0026#xAE;. Apple does not have access to this information when a user chooses to share it with a loved one or doctor.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAdditional Health and Wellness Updates \u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"bwlistdisc\"\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nAn enhanced labs experience comes to Health Records on iPhone, making it easier for users to review their results. Users can view highlights, pin results that may matter most to them, see whether labs are within range, and, for those in the US, access educational content about common lab tests.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nWith watchOS\u0026#xAE; 8, Apple Watch measures respiratory rate — the number of breaths per minute — during sleep. Users can review this information in the Health app and be notified if a meaningful trend has been identified.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe new Mindfulness app in watchOS 8 includes a refresh of the deep breathing experience, as well as another simple way to stay centered and calm. Breathe sessions give users more opportunities to slow down and focus, and feature a new animation. Users also have access to new Reflect sessions, a way to be more mindful that helps them focus on positive thoughts.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nIn iOS 15, users worldwide have an additional option for storing medical records of immunizations and test results directly in the Health app. Now, even if a vaccine provider or medical location doesn't currently support the Health Records feature, it can allow patients to download verifiable COVID-19 vaccination or test result records from an online browser or QR code, so they can easily access them at any time.\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eAvailability\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nThe developer preview of iOS 15 is available to Apple Developer Program members at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.apple.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441156\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005660\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=developer.apple.com\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=d4ebc128ec073fde1b3e62a5c6fbb194\" shape=\"rect\"\u003edeveloper.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e starting today, and a public beta will be available to iOS users next month at \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeta.apple.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441156\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005660\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=beta.apple.com\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=b8f9ce3681c78e5eca67c57fe2fb9fba\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ebeta.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e. New software features will be available this fall as a free software update for iPhone 6s and later. Walking Steadiness will be available this fall as a free software update for iPhone 8 and later. Features are subject to change. Some features may not be available in all regions or all languages, or on all devices. For more information, visit \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fapple.com%2Fios%2Fhealth%2F\u0026amp;esheet=52441156\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005660\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=apple.com%2Fios%2Fhealth\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=60588158d0cd7ab689ba003e9dff6730\" shape=\"rect\"\u003eapple.com/ios/health\u003c/a\u003e. The new Mindfulness app and respiratory rate during sleep measurement will be available on watchOS 8 this fall as a free software update for Apple Watch Series 3 or later paired with iPhone 6s or later, running iOS 15.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003cb xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eFootnote\u003c/b\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u003csup xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e1 \u003c/sup\u003eWorld Health Organization, \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.who.int%2Fnews-room%2Ffact-sheets%2Fdetail%2Ffalls\u0026amp;esheet=52441156\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005660\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=who.int%2Fnews-room%2Ffact-sheets%2Fdetail%2Ffalls\u0026amp;index=4\u0026amp;md5=395bb8504f2922b8915363457171c209\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewho.int/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/falls\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nApple revolutionized personal technology with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Today, Apple leads the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, and Apple TV. Apple's five software platforms — iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS — provide seamless experiences across all Apple devices and empower people with breakthrough services including the App Store, Apple Music, Apple Pay, and iCloud. Apple's more than 100,000 employees are dedicated to making the best products on earth, and to leaving the world better than we found it.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\nNOTE TO EDITORS: For additional information visit Apple Newsroom (\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;esheet=52441156\u0026amp;newsitemid=20210607005660\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=www.apple.com%2Fnewsroom\u0026amp;index=5\u0026amp;md5=12fe95f1fb687a076356c8fd7b138615\" shape=\"rect\"\u003ewww.apple.com/newsroom\u003c/a\u003e), or call Apple's Media Helpline at (408) 974-2042.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n\u0026#xA9; 2021 Apple Inc. Other company and product names may be trademarks of their respective owners.\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=bwnews\u0026amp;sty=20210607005660r1\u0026amp;sid=benz2\u0026amp;distro=nx\u0026amp;lang=en\" id=\"mmgallerylink\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-phrase\"\u003eView source version on businesswire.com: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"mmgallerylink-link\"\u003e\u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005660/en/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210607005660/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/node/21458396","image":[],"channels":[{"name":"Press Releases"}],"stocks":["AAPL"],"tags":[]},"21476817":{"id":21476817,"author":"PRNewswire","created":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 11:37:00 -0400","updated":"Tue, 08 Jun 2021 11:37:33 -0400","title":"Thinking about trading options or stock in Ford, Li Auto, Tesla, Marvell Technology, or Apple?","teaser":"NEW YORK, June 8, 2021 /PRNewswire/ -- InvestorsObserver issues critical PriceWatch Alerts for F, LI, TSLA, MRVL, and AAPL.\n\n    \n                \n                        \n                    \n                        \n  ","body":"\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" id=\"temp_ReleaseStart\"\u003e\u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-location\"\u003eNEW YORK\u003c/span\u003e, \u003cspan xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"xn-chron\"\u003eJune 8, 2021\u003c/span\u003e /PRNewswire/ -- InvestorsObserver issues critical PriceWatch Alerts for F, LI, TSLA, MRVL, and AAPL.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n    \u003cdiv xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" class=\"PRN_ImbeddedAssetReference\" id=\"DivAssetPlaceHolder1\"\u003e\n                \u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003e\n                        \u003ca xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" href=\"https://mma.prnewswire.com/media/1333368/InvestorsObserver_Logo.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\n                    \u003cimg xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\" src=\"https://mma.prnewswire.com/media/1333368/InvestorsObserver_Logo.jpg\" title=\"InvestorsObserver (PRNewsfoto/InvestorsObserver)\" alt=\"InvestorsObserver (PRNewsfoto/InvestorsObserver)\"\u003e\u003c/img\u003e\n                        \u003c/a\u003e\n                \u003c/p\u003e\n\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"\u003eClick a link below then choose between in-depth options trade idea report or a stock score report.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp
